Reviews.Title: “Hate to give away this secret”
Reviews.Author: Nancy B
Reviews.Content: Right in the middle of Greenwich Village, just off Washington Square Park sits this small perfect hotel. Small rooms, great value, clean, and with simple style. Super friendly staff. It feels like you are living in the neighborhood. Near NYU. I think I will always stay there when Im in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Washington Square Hotel (West Village) in the Spring”
Reviews.Author: Travelnfam105
Reviews.Content: It's always an adventure and fun to drive into Manhattan, especially in the rain. Particularly true, when you place your trust into a GPS rather than rely on long-term memory. The GPS took us from NJ through Staten Island to Brookly and over the Brooklyn Bridge rather than under through the Holland Tunnel (long-term memory). So we save a half-hour on traffic and drove through 3 of the 5 boroughs only to find a street fair along Waverly Place in front of the hotel. So, we found our intended parking garage two blocks away and jettisoned the SUV to the street smart guy who was happy to park it deep and forget about for a few days. Only two blocks and we had packed light so we strolled over with suitcases through the food vendors and artists along Waverly. Hotel staff happily greeted us a little before 3 PM, heard at least 3 different languages immediately which confirmed WSH as a European traveler favorite, and ushered us to our comfortable room with a large bath, comfy beds/pillows, free wi-fi, and continental breakfast. Rooms are not large but adequate and well-maintained. Remember, it's location, location, location! We went for a walk in Washington Square Park (built for the100th anniversary of honoring our first elected president) and found a great place for fresh Italian hot chocolate with double expresso) and got re-oriented to the habits and culture of the CITY. Located between 6th (Ave. of Americas) and 7th, WSH is a great base to explore the Village or hale a taxi for downtown (financial district or the place where all our money got lost) or mid-town and fan out shop, search for food, clothes, fabrics (check out West 40th near NY Times building and the foodie places along 7th Ave or the high-end shops over on 5th Ave. Every block east-west or north-south is an adventure as the pulse of the city grabs you. Have fun! Oh, yea! NYC water (by aqueduct from upstate NY) is better than bottled, so fill up before you hit the streets.

Reviews.Title: “More than 2 nights? Upgrade your room.”
Reviews.Author: Ski_Luv
Reviews.Content: All the reviews about a great value and amazing location are true. We had the cheapest room, a Superior Double, which was more than adequate. Immaculate, and loved the vanity. Really didn't need anything else and we will book it again. Still, if you need to be there more than two nights I'd suggest upgrading to a room with either more space, OR MORE IMPORTANTLY, a window looking out over the street. I needed to checkout or have some daylight shining in by then.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough room; substandard service”
Reviews.Author: BTNHome
Reviews.Content: The room is very big, and fairly nice. The bathroom is lovely. The staff in the breakfast room ignored us for 30 minutes while chattering amongst themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, clean and comfortable. Great find!”
Reviews.Author: emmaclarekidd
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 4 day stay at the Washington Square Hotel and cannot sing its praises enough. The location is simply excellent. As first-timers in NYC it was great to stay in an area as laid back and lovely as Greenwich/West Village. You are a stone's throw away from endless bars, restaurants and of course the beautiful Washington Square park but still within walking distance or a cab/subway ride to the major sights. We actually walked the entire length of 5th Avenue from just outside the hotel, which was a great way to see New York by foot. In terms of facilities, the room price included a continental breakfast which consisted of fruit, bagels, croissants, biscuits and muffins, plus yoghurt and cereal. We only ate the breakfast twice as we were spoiled by numerous diners, brunch venues, but it's adequate and will set you up for the day. Our room was admittedly tiny, but we spent very little time in there. It was immaculate in condition and very comfortable. A nice touch is a coffee machine and crisp white bathrobes. We didn't use the hotel bar but it looked lovely and the hotel is equipped with a gym (if you have the inclination, but I'd recommend pounding the streets to get your exercise). The staff were also incredibly attentive and helpful. Always polite, the door staff were particularly friendly, offering shopping, eating and transport advice on our way out every day. Things to do in the area that I'd recommend: Walk along University Pl. (turn left out of the hotel and walk along Waverly Pl. till you see it) - loads of nice shops and cafes. We had brunch at Jacks outside in the sunshine, great menu and good service. Go to Bleecker St. If you like live music you'll love it there, there's tons of live music bars, most with singers/bands/open mic nights on nightly, most free entry. Eat at the Good Stuff Diner: a short walk along 6th Avenue. Simply the best breakfast I have ever eaten and a must for those wanting the quintessential NYC brunch experience. I'm still disappointed I only got to go there once. I can't think of any negatives with this hotel, perhaps except the size of the rooms, but that's New York. All in all, great value for money, fantastic location and brilliant staff. I will be recommending the Washington Sqare to everyone I know who's planning a trip to New York, and I hope to go back there soon myself!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Brad B Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel more than 5 times during the last few years. If you want to be part of the West Village, I know of no better choice. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are typical NY-size. The entire facility is clean. There's a lot going on in this unique, central area, and the Washington Square Hotel makes you feel like part of the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel, shame about the chaotic breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: LeicaUser
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for nearly a week at the beginning of March and had an excellent stay. Never having been to New York before, we chose the Washington Square on the recommendation of a friend and am pleased to say that it was a very comfortable stay. Our room, 718, was on the corner, almost overlooking the Square, on the front elevation. It wasn't a large room, but it was comfortable, clean and with the facilities one would expect. However, the street outside can get noisy in the night, with refuse trucks collecting in the small hours. On one night, the City decided to mend the road opposite the hotel. Jack-hammers at 11:30pm until 2:30am is not something I was expecting. Not the hotel's fault, though, and the desk clerk did go and speak with the workforce on our behalf and offer us earplugs. The breakfast can either be a cooked or a continental buffet. On our first morning, a Sunday, the continental was in a sub-basement room/bar area and was great. A wide variety of pastures, bagels, etc, cereals, fruit, yoghurts, etc. Later in the week, this room was always closed, and we had to eat in the serviced area. The continental was still gratis, but you had no choice, as the waiters went to the kitchen to fetch the food. The cooked offer, which we ate one morning, was "OK". I didn't write home about it. Don't try to eat ion the ground floor bar - the tables a rev far too small. Very friendly doorman, Ronnie, who had lots of hints and advice about visiting the city and excellent desk staff. Would definitely stay here again, if in the City, but would make sure the earplugs were handy.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay in midtown when the best of Manhattan's music, food and style is across the street from Washington Square Park.”
Reviews.Author: smkluck
Reviews.Content: Stay here period! Forget the big name chains in Manhattan and get away from the masses in midtown. Head downtown and have fun while in NYC. Situated close to SoHo in the West Village (the best neighborhood in NYC) blocks from the most music venues you will ever find. This hotel is the best value while still maintaining a fun, hip vibe you will find.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: mgrnyc
Reviews.Content: Washington Square is a great choice. The room was a good size and very clean. I got an excellent night's sleep on their comfortable King bed. My only criticism would be the continental breakfast. It was adequate, but lacking in variety and seating - although it is possible to take your breakfast to go. I found the hotel restaurant "North Square" to be a much better choice for breakfast. I was stunned by the delicious breakfast I got for a very modest price. 9.00 for 3 eggs, delicious breads, chicken sausage, fruit salad, coffee and juice - All Included!

Reviews.Title: “Our home in New York City”
Reviews.Author: Margaret E
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Washington Square Hotel for many years. We go to NYC on business (and stay for pleasure) three times a year and usually stay for 10 days. We love the Washington Square. Great location, great staff, and a lovely restaurant. No room service, but breakfast is served downstairs. Clean and quiet. Not trendy, but perfectly suited for adults.

Reviews.Title: “Great (and cheap!) stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Chris P
Reviews.Content: My wife and I debated for hours on where to stay during our first trip to New York City and we settled on the Washington Square Hotel in Greenwich Village. The thought of staying right in Time Square didn't appeal to us as we like to stay clear of tourist traps for our hotels. This hotel had incredibly friendly and helpful staff, notably Rodney who works as a doorman/concierge/need-anything man in the lobby. He let us know where the good restaurants were, transit information and even his best chicken recipe! As for the room itself, the Deluxe King Room (6th floor) was incredibly clean, spacious (even by NYC standards) and very comfortable. Wall-mounted plasma, ipod/iphone alarm dock and charger, king bed, great vanity, robes, safe and all the usual amenities for $225/night. The price for this level quality is apparently unheard of in NYC. We stayed 3 nights. As for the area, there's a drug store right around the corner on 6th Av, the street it's on (Waverly) is incredibly quiet and really quaint. Too many restaurants in the area to list and you're very close walking distance from Washington Square Park, SOHO, East and West Village for shopping and sightseeing. The area is very safe, subways are one block away and cabs to midtown are under 10 bucks. I will absolutely be staying here again and I recommend anybody staying a few nights in the City to use this awesome little place as a home base.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Escrime23
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful (Thank you Ronnie and Nick). From the hotel it's easy to walk up 5th Ave or grab a cab anywhere. The subway is half a block away. The restaurant and bar/lounge had good food and a relaxing atmosphere. The room was small but clean and neat and the rates reasonable. It was a great find and I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Superior to the chain hotels”
Reviews.Author: midlandvoyager
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from spending 4 nights at the Washington Square Hotel. It is the second visit after a gap of 9 years and it was a pleasure to return. Rooms have been refurbished but the hotel has not lost its charm and the staff all proved helpful and very friendly. We dined in their North Square Restaurant twice at night and also for lunch before leaving; the quality and presentation of the food was excellent and the service efficient and friendly. Having stayed in skyscraper chain hotels coming to the Washington Square is a pleasure. Rooms are well equiped including 'pod' coffee machines however one small room for improvement would be good sized bath sheets in place of towels. This hotel will however be our first choice when next revisiting NewYork.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Joe Y
Reviews.Content: Overall a good experience. An ideal location in a quiet neighborhood, close to subway near a fabulous, hip section of Greenwich Village. The air-conditioners aren't the best in the room and make too much noise. The reception staff wasn't the greatest although the doorman and bellboys were terrific. The room was clean, although a little small, bed comfortable, tv too high on the wall.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in Heart of Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Paule_8353
Reviews.Content: The Washington Square Hotel in Manhattan is a quaint (small) hotel in a period building across from the famous Washington Square park that was highlighted in the movie "Searching for Bobby Fischer". You can play chess with the local chess sharks. You pay them a nominal fee and they beat you but teach at the same time. Our chess playing 10 year old daughter had the adventure of playing with "Jack" for $5.00 right under a sign that said, "playing games for money is strictly prohibited in this park". But she enjoyed herself thoroughly. The old gentleman was so nice and played quite a few games and gave her many suggestions. The hotel is beautifully renovated and architecturally interesting. The service, linens, food were just great. We would absolutely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Diego C
Reviews.Content: Although well kept and everything works, everything about this hotel is small and cramped. The service varies from rude to very professional, depending on the person depending on who is working the front desk. The location, however, is excellent as it is 1 block from the subway lines west of 5th Avenue and about 3 blocks from the subway lines on Broadway, close to the park and many restaurants etc in the West Village.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and security in the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: JJJJ2011
Reviews.Content: We will return to Hotel Washington Square, as we love the area of the village. The big park there is filled with activity, chess games, students, dog walkers and squirrels. So much within walking distance: clubs, restos, shopping, neighborhoods and good times. Staff is so friendly and helpful, especially with transportation questions. True comfort, good sleep and excellent service with an old world artistic feel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: lifeastrin
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel on December 2nd for 5 nights with Virgin Holidays. We paid for a deluxe room which from the website seems the only difference between that and superb room was you were given a view of something. We arrived after a horrendous trip through JFK. Apparently they were short staffed and we queued through security for well over two hours, just stood in lines of people. My husband is a diabetic and began to feel seriously ill. When we arrived at the hotel we were just grateful to be there at last. The room was big. I was surprised as people here had commented the rooms were tiny. But I was really disappointed that the window faced a brick wall. Now really I had no right to complain here as we never said anything but after the traumatic JFK experience we were grateful to unpack and collapse on the bed, then it seemed silly to say anything. The room was lovely, comfy bed but very soft. Nice bathroom, TV channels ace and a lovely coffee maker. The hotel is lovely. The location is great. Who wants to stay uptown in the hussle bussle and noise of the city when you can easily reach there on the subway and you are in a nice leafy peaceful place facing the lovely washington square park with the friendly chubby squirrels and all the bars and restaurants around the area. Breakfast was nice. We always got a table. The bagels and pastries were delicious. Nothing hot but I'm not a big breakfast person anyways. I noted there were little boxes on the tables and think if you can't find a table to eat (as it is very small) you can fill them and take them back to your room. A good idea. Reception staff were efficient and pleasant. The concierge was a character indeed! I needed a needle and cotton one day and it was brought to me instantly. Nothing was too much trouble, I loved the christmas decorations outside. It was a good holiday and we would stay there again at the drop of a hat.

Reviews.Title: “We will return.”
Reviews.Author: alanmorgan73
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 nights over Xmas and could not be happier with the location, exactly what we wanted walking distance to tribeca and all the restaurants, cafes and coffee houses. cute shops and squirrels everywhere. lived as much as we could like a local walking everywhere from alphabet city, SoHo, meat packers to even wall street. made the short subway trip to the more tourist spots like central part and Broadway but came back to the area every night to eat. Oh how i wish i could live there. breakfasts where usual cereals, eggs, yoghurt, fruits etc rooms where small but I dont get why people complain about small rooms as your on holiday and its basically only a bed you need anyway and in a heritage building what do you expect they can not knock walls down? If you want a big room stay in a boring Hilton or Four Seasons. The outside was done up nicely for Xmas with trees and lights and a big tree in Washington square just 1 min walk away towards NYU. we will definitely stay again in our next visit in a few years time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for great village weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Melrosetoo
Reviews.Content: A plus with one minus. Saturday PM "concierge" less than helpful and actually unhelpful when getting a cab. Feet were not happy to be told to walk a block in the slush and party shoes to get a cab at 7pm! All other staff at all levels were excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location with a comfortable charm...”
Reviews.Author: MissDebonair
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by a friend, and it was lovely. We chose a small room, as we figured we'd be out and about so much it wouldn't matter, and it was fine; in fact I think the cosiness made it more special and intimate for a couple anyway. The lobby was delightful and the concierge was so friendly and full of well-intended personality. We really liked him, and he made us feel happy and welcome. The Uni graduation was happening the week we were there and everything was purple and there were proud families everywhere, which was kinda sweet to be around. We were able to walk to all the things we wanted to see in Soho and the Village, and all the very best comedy stores are just around the corner. We laughed more in our 3 days here than we've laughed in our whole lives, most likely, so it was a great stay. Also loved the surrounding architecture and all the loacls walking their designer dogs. I felt a bit like an extra in a Woody Allen film, and I loved it all.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs for a three star hotel”
Reviews.Author: J S
Reviews.Content: After paying 350 dollars a night for a deluxe queen, I was moved to a standard double because of the horrible bed with the mattress that dipped in the middle. They still charged me for the deluxe queen. After moving between rooms 2 times and still ended up with a poor bed, I decided to give up and put up with it... until I realised I was bitten by bed bugs a day later. Breakfast was very average with cold food.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,great location!”
Reviews.Author: Marie-Louise D
Reviews.Content: Freindly cosy hotel located in Greenwich. Quiet spacious rooms, cosy wine bar and award winning restaurant. Staff exceptionally friendly, especially the doorman.They dont make you feel like just another tourist. Breakfast included in our package,and I was able to order boiled eggs cooked to perfection each morning at an extra cost of $2 !! We will definetly be making this our base in NYC when next we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Eddie_S57
Reviews.Content: Firts time in NY and we sayed in this hotel for 7 nights. Smal room, but clean and cozy. Metro at "the next corner" and walking distance to everything. Near Greenwich Village and Meatdistrict, lots of restaurants .... Jazz clubs ..... Short terms, Great location and nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Get Away Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LeslieK822
Reviews.Content: If you are tired of those big hotel chains and want personal attention the Washington Square Hotel is for you! It is in a perfect location that allows you to walk everywhere...or just across the street to one of New York's best parks. If you want a 5 star dinner, Babbo is right across the street! I celebrated my birthday during our stay and the staff upgraded my room and left a great bottle of champagne. It was a great get away, and this hotel was a big part of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for $250 a night”
Reviews.Author: louragankatrina
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights over Canadian Thanksgiving weekend. Room was very nice, clean and modern. Heard no noise at all from halls or street, but we were on 6th floor. The included breakfast and coffee was a nice treat. Great location located across from Washington Square Park and just west of Greenwich Village. Staff was friendly and helpful to navigate the subways. Would defintely come back!

Reviews.Title: “best location in the city, nice hotel, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: BobMiles10003
Reviews.Content: We live a block away and use the hotel a lot for our guests. We had two rooms over Christmas. Center of the Village is the best location. Easy subway to Times Sq or anywhere else – but you don’t need to go far for the best of the city. Hotel has lot’s of character. Staff is always nice, rooms always clean, free coffee in room, free wifi, free really good breakfast. For the city it is also very quiet. Because of Christmas we could have stayed at the W for the same price but our guests stayed at Wash SQ before, enjoyed it and just wanted to stay there. Rooms are small but you should not be spending much time inside anyway – there is too much to do. Five minutes to east and west village (as if Greenwich was not enough) ten minutes to Tribeca, Soho & Nolita, Union Square, 20 minutes walk to Chinatown and Little Italy so go for a walk until you collapse in your small but clean room. One more thing – they have really friendly neighbors.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: lcassidy71
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in December at the W.S.H. and loved every minute of our stay. The location has been way mentioned in other reviews, in a word just great. The hotel is well maintained with a charming lobby and our room was indeed a big surprise: we feared a phone booth sized one but ours was more than adequate for two persons, I'd say even largish for NY's standards and very clean. It was also pretty quiet, we didn't need to use earplugs (absolutely essential for a good sleep in other parts of the city, e.g. Theater District). The continental breakfast included was rich and tasty and we could choose to have it buffet-style or served at the table. A very big plus are the desk and lobby staff: very professional and always genuinely nice. We'd definitely recommend this hotel, it's one of the biggest bang for the buck and overall nicest stays we've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: pdev1977
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days in December at this hotel and loved it. It was our 3rd trip to NYC and we had stayed in Times square and in one of the Hiltons, but although this place is no where near as grand, it more than makes up for it with its charm and location. The village is the place to be to experience the real New York, literally hundreds of bars, diners, restaurants etc... to suit every taste and budget.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: weemoose
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at the beginning of December on our second trip to NY. Chose this hotel due to its location and generally positive reviews. Ronnie the concierge (well, professional meeter and greeter more like) gave us a great welcome and lots of useful tips during our stay, although at times was a little over exhuberant. Our room was on the first floor facing the back and not as small as we feared, plenty of space for two people, spotlessly clean although no view, quite dark and really really hot! Pleased to have fluffy robes, free wi fi and tea/coffee facilities in the room. Its unusual to get any kind of breakfast included in a hotel stay in NY so the inclusion of cereals, yoghurt, pastries, fruit and bagels was most welcome and more than adequate. The interior of the lobby and salon/bar on the ground floor is very charming and at Xmas time the hotel really sparkled. A quaint little hotel in a great spot. I'd recommend a stay here to others.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: BittanB
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel. Perfect location, reasonable rates, great staff...and a quite all right continental breakfast included!

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable at Affordable Prices”
Reviews.Author: brianwhAustralia
Reviews.Content: This boutique is everything that it says it is. Wife and I stayed here for 4 nights in mid-November. The location is great - ideally situated for the underground railway giving access to anywhere in Manhattan; near a lot of very good restaurants as well as cheap fast food places. The hotel itself is a little old but retains old world charm. The staff are friendly and welcoming. The rooms are small (what do you expect in New York if you don't want to pay an arm and a leg!) but clean and adequate. We found them quiet although wondered whether the air conditioning would be a bit noisy in summer.We found the bar, where you could sit and have a quiet drink then order and eat your food from the hotel restaurant, the perfect way to finish the day. We have no hesitation in recommending the Washington Square Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location - and friendliness”
Reviews.Author: ithaca96
Reviews.Content: New York is notorious for expensive hotels, so it`s a joy to find one that meets most criteria, at an affordable price. And in a great spot, on the corner of the lively Washington Square, with chess players, dogs, elegant bag ladies and everything else. Easy access to the metro, and lots of interesting sights within walking distance. One of the things that made us fall in love with the hotel, was the extreme friendliness of all the staff. Big smiles, real interest in us and willingness to help is something that is definitely not found everywhere, especially not in big city hotels. The restaurant serves lovely food at night, and the breakfast is good and copious. The rooms are on the smallish side, but it works for couples and good friends. Nicely outfitted, and kept clean and tidy. There are quite a few good restaurants in the area, a big plus point for the hotel is the Italian restaurant Babbo just across the street. A great place to eat, reservations necessary, but we actually got a table for the same evening on a Sunday... We would very much like to come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great People !”
Reviews.Author: marcomillennium
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and so much more personal than the Midtown/Uptown alternatives. Everything was as described on the website. Staff were universally friendly and helpful. The inclusive continental breakfast was a useful bonus. Thanks for a great stay !

Reviews.Title: “Affordable hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mariquiroga
Reviews.Content: The best things about the WSH are definitely the location (across from the beautiful Washington Sq Park, very close to great restaurants and attractions in the Village, Lower East Side, Soho, etc) and the service (great attention from the front desk to a variety of miscellaneous requests). The rooms are ok, I guess average for a small hotel in NYC. Not bad, compared to many other options - but not great either (well, as they say, the goal in a trip to NY is to *not* stay inside the room). Overall, we liked our room. It had a couple of small defects - we had a double bed that was a little soggy in one side (did not bother me) but fine on the other, and the closet is small, but that's typical in NY, in my experience. There was no fridge in our room, but we did have a good coffee maker. Breakfast was included in our room rate (not sure if this is standard); it consisted of a simple cold buffet of cereal, fruits, good pastries, yogurt and bagel/ cream cheese, plus coffee & juices. In all, the value was very good for the price and location, and we were pleasantly surprised with the attentive and caring service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: BeckyMillar
Reviews.Content: This was my friend and my first trip to NY and we were recommended the Washington Square Hotel for its location and price. It lived up to its reputation in that it is a good price and a fabulous location. 5th Ave starts just under the arch in Washington Square Park! On arrival to the hotel at 2.30pm (after a long day travelling) we were met by what I can only say as an unfriendly moody receptionist who didn't really look at us when we spoke to her and said our room wasn't ready. We had to prompt her to say when it may be ready and were told 3.30pm (half an hour later than it should be). We were not offered an explanation or ideas of what to do in the mean time...NY is rather daunting when you first arrive! However the lovely guy on the door offered to take our cases and suggested we make the most of the beautiful weather and go to Washington Square Park, which we did. We arrived back at 3.20pm to be met by another moody receptionist who said our room was ready and asked for a credit card in most rude manner. I'm afraid to say at this point after 10 hours + travelling I did say that I was tired and irritable and was likey to snap back at her at any moment and after this, she became helpful and friendly! We finally arrived to our room and had to wait as the cleaner was still vacuuming! He didn't take long though and we were in. I have to say we were both a little disappointed on first glance. The room was very small and dark (view from window was a brick wall) and was in need of a lick of paint. However, it was immaculately clean and the bathroom was more than adequate with nice thick heavy robes for our use. The wardrobe is a joke for 2 women sharing! We had to stuff clothes in bedside table drawers etc! The room did its job though, we were only there to sleep in any case as NY has so much to see and do. We did go to the breakfast buffet once but it was rather dull. Cold pastries and cereal. We wanted pancakes!!!! I would stay here again but would request a better room with a view if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, crappy rooms”
Reviews.Author: Kat B
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because its so close to NYU (like 2 mins top walking distance). The front staff personnel was EXTREMELY helpful before and during my stay (Thanks again, Maggie), providing above and beyond service. When I arrived very early (9:30am), they were able to find me a room and check me in well before check-in. Margaret provided excellent recommendations for lunch and dinner- she even went door-to-door to find me a private room for dinner! The bellhop was extremely pleasant and helpful as well. BUT, I was on the first floor, and the noise from the street was unbearable. The unsightly and unplugged AC unit in the window prohibited me from closing the window, and the shades didn't keep the light out. There was construction at midnight, which kept me up. I might as well have had the windows open. The closet was tiny, and impossible to use with the huge robes inside. Overall, the staff was the best I've ever had, but it still doesn't make up for the awful room.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Resukts”
Reviews.Author: Traveler468
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is ideally located in the Soho/GV area. The hotel's public areas are spotless and well maintaiend as are the rooms. No bug issues here. We had a room with two double beds, and unfortunately one was well beyonf its usefull lifespan...think sliding out onto the floor from a sagging bed. They must have failed to put soud-deadening materila in the ceiling...noise all the time when someone is above you. Very small rooms, especially for 3 people (self, wife, daughter). They have employees in lobby that appear to be bellhops, but they don't assist with luggage and are not very helpful in answering questions. They tell you to go ask the front desk. Front desk personell generally pleasant, except for one emplyee who did not really like being intererupted with questions. Have been to NYC and stayed in boutique type hotels numerous times, and for what you pay here, there are better options. In the Soho area you may have to spend some time looking for them. There is an excellent restaurant with the hotel called the North Square.which which was very good. The Continental breakfast which goes with the room is good, but the menu items which are rather inexpenzxiver are really worth a try.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, old world charm”
Reviews.Author: BTT65
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in early October. We are frequent travelers to NY but had never stayed in the Village before. The hotel's location can not be beat. This charming hotel is located on the corner of Washington Square park and a short walk to subway and many fabulous restaurants in the Village and Soho. The continental breakfast was a nice touch to get the day started and the staff was very helpful. Our room was a decent size and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: kate_hartley
Reviews.Content: The Washington Square Hotel was a great find. It's an old-fashioned, quirky hotel with bags of character and friendly staff, and a cosy bar downstairs that was perfect for a late nightcap. Don't expect luxurious rooms, but they were clean and comfortable, and good value. It's right by Washington Square, so the location is fantastic for exploring Greenwich Village, SoHo etc, and feels safe to walk round or come back to late at night. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel, a good price and a brilliant location.”
Reviews.Author: Kw274
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after a recomendation from a friend. It was everything we hoped and more. I spent ages looking at rates and with the advance booking discount this was a bargain. It was clean, well maintained and the staff couldn't have been friendlier. The Hotel is in a great location in what felt like a very safe area and we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Make you feel like family”
Reviews.Author: jlsjdunn
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here a few times over the past 18 months as our daughter started attending school nearby. The staff is very friendly and helpful. It's an ideal location in Greenwich Village. Rooms are always clean. Historic building with lots of charm. Continental breakfast is a great convenience with great coffee. Nice to have restaurant there as well if you want a bigger breakfast or any other meals and it also has a bar. We moved our daughter in this year during the weekend of the hurricane. Washington Square Hotel offered free sandwiches and soup both Sat. and Sun. as many businesses had closed.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff in town”
Reviews.Author: Margaret T
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in (travel weary and crumpled!), we were treated like royalty. Every person on the staff at this hotel provided the best service we've received in years. The location is great, close to the park, the subway, good restaurants and pubs. Special mention for "Curry Kitchen" round the block for excellent Indian food. Thanks also to Ronnie for his upbeat, helpful local knowledge and the potato cakes recipe.

Reviews.Title: “Just as good as we remembered”
Reviews.Author: Sandra J
Reviews.Content: First stayed at the Washington in 2003 and decided to go back this trip...so glad we did! Although the rooms are small, they are very comfortable and clean. Free breakfast are a bonus although there are so many great restuarants nearby you are spoiled for choice. Great location with two Subway stations within easy walking distance. Washington Sq Gardens are also on your doorstep and on a sunny day a great place just to 'hang out' especially if the guy is playing his grand piano - how he gets it there on a daily basis we didnt discover! Staff are friendly and helpful with information, recommendations and arranging taxis etc for you. Would certainly recommend as a great palce to stay,

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Uldis T
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a number of times over the space of the last five years. To sum it up, it's a reasonably priced Manhattan hotel in a wonderful location. The plus points for this location as opposed to elsewhere on the island are that it's quiet on a night, unlike most other hotel locations on the island particularly midtown around the Times Square area. The area is great for decent bars and restaurants on an evening. The village is a much nicer place to be than midtown for nearly everything. If it's your first visit you'll want to see Times Square, the Empire State and the like, which isn't a problem, there's a subway entrance on the corner of the same block. Decent shopping is available a short walk away on Broadway and in Soho. The hotel itself is very pleasant, the rooms are a reasonable size, you shouldn't really expect anything too big in Manhattan, but they're nicely decorated and very clean. The continental breakfast is another bonus, it's more than sufficient to keep you going till lunch, and is not always offered at other hotels in Manhattan for free. I can heartily recommend this hotel. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value and location”
Reviews.Author: barbiespice99
Reviews.Content: So happy with our choice to stay at Washington Square Hotel. It's only a couple of blocks from multitudes of restaurants, and one block from the subway. The neighbourhood was quiet and safe. The free buffet breakfast was a bonus. Would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, clean & great location”
Reviews.Author: lafou
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute crash pad for me. The room was small, but spotlessly clean, had a great mattress and linens. Toiletries and a coffee/tea maker are in the room. Continental breakfast was included. To top it off, I was on the top floor and had a view. I have been in some small hotel rooms in NYC and this one was small, but you do not have to be a contortionist to move around the room. There is an abundance of restaurants and entertainment within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Unpretentious inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: warwkscruiseholic
Reviews.Content: Excellent position, clean, excellent staff could not fault anything will certainly stay there again, wanted to take Ronnie home

Reviews.Title: “"Inexpensive" typical non-chain NYC Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Livin_in_Germany
Reviews.Content: New York City hotel rooms are small. Unless you get a suite, it doesn't matter if you pay $650 or $250 night. Of course, "usually" the more you pay the more amenities are available at the hotel. The Washington Square Hotel is one of those non-chain hotels that can be found on many streets in NYC and which can be a real find or a real disaster. I consider the WSH a find. It was recommended to me by the company I was visiting in the area when all other hotels, even the "economy" brands were asking $550+ for one night. As noted, the room was small, but updated and clean. The bathroom was fine for one or two persons. The only downside was in an effort to keep it very clean, it had a faint smell of bleach which must be used to keep the old style tile floor clean. There was a window AC unit which work very well, but was kind of loud. I finally turned it off in the middle of the night so it wouldn't wake me as it cycled on and off. But I am a light sleeper. Check in was easy and very pleasant. Without asking I was offered a map and directions (which I didn't need). I had a drink in the small bar. A generous drink for a fair (NYC) price was provided by a pleasant server. It was a welcome respite after a long day of travel to the city. I did not partake of the free continental breakfast. Free WIFI was available throughout the hotel. This is a fine hotel if you're looking for a less expensive, less frills hotel near the village (and NYU). Many subway lines have stations within two or three blocks. I will stay here again when business brings me back to this area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Feel of a B&B”
Reviews.Author: CanadianBoys
Reviews.Content: A great location just off Washington Square. Room was small with twin beds that were suitable for children. We are not big or tall - but our feet hung over the end of the matress. We found the mattresses uncomfortable and after 5 nights ended up with sore backs. Small bathroom with liitle counter space. Hotel reminded us of several Euro pensions we have stayed at. Continental breakfast basic and provided within the room rate. Monotonous after day 3 but other places to eat nearby. we booked at the hotel website and prepaid for best rate. Staff were great except for one lady at front desk who fankly could care less we about us. That put a damper on asking for further assistance. We would pay more to stay elsewhere in a larger full service hotel next time in the theatre district or Chelsea.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: lesley100
Reviews.Content: Situated in my favourite area of NYC, close to great restaurants and shops. Washington Square Park is an experience everyone should have, full of crazy, lively activity day and night, there is always something to see there. The hotel rooms are small but that's New York and once you get used to it, it's fine. It was more luxurious than I expected with bath robes, coffee machine, and the usual little soaps in the bathroom. The bed was lovely and comfortable and all the amenities you could want are there. Breakfast was included which was a buffet so you can fill up. Very clean hotel, friendly staff and great location, what more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “Stay for location and staff”
Reviews.Author: fishmantas
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights there clean rooms, not that big but nice view of the park.Aircon drove us nuts as very noisy but you get that!!Spent a small fortune in the bar downstairs as barman ultra friendly and very intimate bar ,whenever NY overpowered me I would just go and sit in the park to chillout..aaaahhhhh.also restaurant was good.

Reviews.Title: “I think this will be my NYC hotel from now on”
Reviews.Author: KC_Renee
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the location of the hotel. Right near Washington Square Park, great restaurants/bars & shopping. What more could you ask for? It has a neighborhood feel instead of a touristy feel which I enjoy. Otto (one of Mario Batali's restaurants) is right around the corner. It's not only delicious but very reasonably priced. Bars like the Four Faced Liar & Slaughtered Lamb on 6th & Fat Black P****cat on 3rd are all great neighborhood bars. Shopping is only a handful of blocks away on Broadway! The hotel is clean with decent size rooms & bathrooms. I have nothing negative to say about this hotel. I loved it and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in Greenwich!”
Reviews.Author: Tracy H
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights after being recommended by a friend. Great location, mins to the subway and easy to get from Newark Int. Airport via Air Train and NJ Transit. We were told that rooms were small so went for Executive double. Worth the money and included continental breakfast. Food was excellent (especially the rack of lamb at dinner in their own restaurant) but lots of other restaurants close by if you want to get out and explore locally. Would recommend a vegetarian restaurant called GOBO on 6th Avenue - minutes from the hotel. Wonderful food and menu items out of the ordinary for sure! No complaints about the hotel at all, very clean and comfortable and quiet at night. Very helpful staff in all areas. Will return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Dont want to go back”
Reviews.Author: slipper
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel for a july stay for my daughter's NYU orientation. The location is wonderful. next to Washington square park: wonderful to be in the Village. I thoroughly enjoyed walking all over lower manhattan. FOr me though The only thing the hotel has going for it is the location: The rooms are TINY even by New York standards. The decor is old, drab and tired. No room service, though in New York that isnt a problem. Free Wifi. The hallway from the elevator to our room was so narrow that you had to walk single file: 2 people couldn't fit; seems like a fire hazard to me. Kind of a depressing place inside after you leave the lobby. The staff were friendly, and responded to requests in a reasonable time. The toilet water didnt fill properly and it kept happening every day despite the fact that it was supposedly fixed. The housecleaning staff turned off the air conditioner in our room so i came back after a long day to a hot room. And the air conditioning is the old fashioned conditioner in the window frame. No one helped with our luggage when we came in. Though the bellman was great when we checked out. the front desk people were friendly. It took some doing though to get our boarding passes printed; it involved some convoluted process that included my emailing a ticket confirmation to the front desk person.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Greenwich location, friendly people, can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Miex
Reviews.Content: During a six night stay in the first week of September we found the WS Hotel to be the best possible base from which to explore New York. The hotel offers a very good price/quality balance in expensive New York. The king room we stayed in on the 8th floor was large enough by NY standards and had a nice view. Good bathroom, good bed, good housekeeping. Excellent table service at breakfast giving us a good start to the day. Located on a corner of Washington Park, a haven of friendliness and impromptu live music by people hooking up, playing guitars and singing. The subway is a two minute walk away, hooking you up with the A,B,C,D,E,F lines, 4 stops to Times Square in the North, and 4 stops to WTC in the South. In Greenwich Village and nearby Soho, you can spend a week and never be bored. Quaint shops, bars, restaurants and lovely winding tree-lined streets where the next delicious espresso and blueberry pecan cookie is never far away.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel with art deco style”
Reviews.Author: Moody_Margaret
Reviews.Content: I booked this for 5 nights because I was looking for a reasonably-priced hotel in the village area that hadn't had any reports about bed bugs. Previously we've chosen to stay in midtown hotels but were looking for something a bit more relaxed and I was so glad that I found this hotel. Washington Square itself is a lovely park/public area with dog-walkers, guys playing chess, joggers, birds, squirrels, pushchairs, low key musicians. Walking through it was a very pleasant way to begin and end the day. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful throughout. Decor was generally very good and had a bit of quirky character in the hallways. Our room was small (but I've stayed in smaller), and the view from our window was uninspiring (but I was prepared for that after deciding to book their most budget-friendly room). However the room was spotlessly clean and the bedsheets were crisp, white and good quality. I'm slightly embarrassed to admit that I'd brought a torch to look for bed bugs but after a close inspection I was reassured that the beds were clean everywhere. Despite paying a purse-friendly price for our room there were lots of amenities to make a stay more pleasant: bathrobes, hairdryer, bathroom toiletries, a great coffee maker, ipod alarm clock. Minor niggles were that I could only see one free electrical socket (2 people with a phone each need 2 sockets) and there was only a small supply of coffee/milk for 2 people. There wasn't a fridge but there was an ice bucket and ice available. The continental breakfast (bagels, croissants, cereals, fruit, yoghurt, juice, coffee, tea) was a bonus as was the free wi-fi. We didn't take our laptops but used my iphone to look up local directions to restaurants, subways, stores and cinemas and so found the wi-fi a lot more useful than expected. The hotel really added to the enjoyment of our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful as expected”
Reviews.Author: elisabeth_nj
Reviews.Content: I have always wanted to stay at the WSH but never could get a reservation (sold out). Finally after our trip to New Orleans was cancelled due to Tropical Storm Lee we decided to spend our anniversary in NYC just like past years (at the last minute). The WSH did not disappoint. It was everything and more I thought it would be. Clean, spacious, umbrella, bathrobes and a safe, etc. in your closet. Staff was extremely friendly, got a free upgrade by mentioning I was a friend on Facebook and the coffee/muffins in the morning sure did the trick. Special shout out to Ron the doorman, he is an extremely friendly and wonderful man. This is the perfect location for us and the price was more PERFECT! P.S. I'm not including pics because they are the same wonderful shots others have posted!

Reviews.Title: “Good, Central and Safe”
Reviews.Author: 1fussymum
Reviews.Content: Was first trip to NYC, so relied on Trip Advisor reviews to pick hotel. Was happy with the hotel overall. Shocked at how small the hotel rooms were - but that has more to do with living in the Middle East where the hotel rooms are always very expansive. Bathroom and room were clean and the location of this place is perfect. My only complaint was that the airconditioner rattled all night long, and when I was there it was quite warm! The air conditioner would just turn off randomly as well.

Reviews.Title: “Always our first choice in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Sealless99
Reviews.Content: We flew in five hours early to beat Hurricane Irene and start a week long stay in New York. We were able to check in at 7:45 in the morning - a blessing after getting up at 3 a.m. The queen room was spacious and clean and even had a view of the park. Everybody on staff is friendly and helpful. And you can not beat the location - near the Village, the park, the subway. This is a great little hotel - we plan our trips to New York based on whether or not we can get a reservation at this property.

Reviews.Title: “WSH great value and location.”
Reviews.Author: Curley73
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days in August 2011. Room was good, I hear they can be hit n miss. But the location, value and service were faultless, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun had by all!”
Reviews.Author: 7continents
Reviews.Content: Two of my college girlfriends and I stayed here August 5-7. The hotel has king, two doubles or two twin rooms. I will say the rooms are your standard NYC room, meaning on the smaller size and definitely not your big chain hotel size room. We had a King room and a room with tow doubles. The king had much more room than the queen, even room for a pack and play if you needed to place one in the room. The king room als had a "makeup" table with a lit mirror in front of it. The double room had something similar. Our double had two closets one for hanging clothes and the other had the safe and shelves. I will say that the shower in our double was too powerful. It was good for washing my thick hair, but not for sensitive skin areas. There was always plenty of hot water and the room was clean. The A/C was a little different in that you had window units in each room. Luckily, we had a new unit and it cooled well, but it felt humid in the room. However, my friend's room had an older unit and it did not cool very well or remove the humidity. My only complaint would be that these were supposed to be non-smoking rooms, but as soon as we went in you could smell the lingering smell of smoke. The hotel also has free continental breakfast, but we wanted something a little more substantial so I can not speak to the quality of the breakfast. As far as the location goes , it was excellent. It is located on the northwest corner of Washington Park. You walk across the street and you can hang out in the park. The fountain is fun for kids to splash and play in. It is only a half block or less to the Metro. You have so many good restaurants and sweet shops in the village. Fish was a good restaurant for dinner, as was Union Square Cafe, the Bagel shop had wonderful breakfast bagels. The western omelet bagel was delicious. You can walk from the hotel to chinatown, Soho, Noho. Overall good location for visiting NYC. Plus you are not in the hubbub of Midtown. The staff was very helpful with taxis, food ideas and shopping ideas.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: SallyI75
Reviews.Content: Having never been to NYC before, I was unsure where to stay. I wanted to be able to get around the city easily but be based in a quieter area. This hotel gives that. The local area is great; plenty of good restaurants and coffee shops, easy walking distance to many interesting places in the Village, and very close to metro stations which give access to a number of different lines. The room was small, but very comfortable and the bathroom had a tub and shower which is unusual in a hotel of this size. Breakfast was included which was great, although if you're looking for the archetypal American breakfast cross Sixth Avenue to the Waverley Diner. There is a Starbucks at the end of the block; perfect for buying a coffee in the morning before sitting in Washington Square Park. The staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel's retro styling is attractive. I'll definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, super friendly staff !”
Reviews.Author: samwv
Reviews.Content: We originally chose this hotel because it was in a quiet area..off 6th Ave and next to Washuington Sq.(green area)...and it was close to where our daughter lives. This was our second stay this year.( they offer a discount for prepayment) The rooms are exceptionally clean and well furnished and the beds comfortable. However, the staff is what makes this hotel shine! Up at 4am to catch a flight, at the hotel by 9 and they offered welcomed us with an extra continental breakfast and immediate check-in. Ronnie, the doorman, has an infectious smile and greeting to go with it...and is quick to offer suggestions on sites, walks etc. For a small hotel that welcomes you like family it can't be beat !

Reviews.Title: “Fab little hotel in a fab location!”
Reviews.Author: Lennie25
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in June and we loved it. Having not visited NY before I was quite shocked initially when I saw the prices of hotels so I decided to do my research. After searching through numerous hotels and locations (and of course reading many reviews on TA!) I opted for the Washington Square and we were not disappointed. I booked it through the hotel's website as it was alot cheaper than going through other web sites. The location is great, loads of bars, restaurants & shops. It is well located to get to mid town and downtown, we walked everywhere but there are subway stops nearby. There is a great restaurant close to the hotel called Cafe Asean, the food is fantastic and very reasonably priced. The breakfast is good, we had continental included and you can then pay for a cooked breakfast if you wish. We didn't as we enjoyed the continental, plenty of choice and the fresh orange juice is delish! Our room was on the top floor and we had an amazing view of the Empire State Building which was very unexpected! Overall I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and we would certainly stay here again if we return to NY.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel, great neighborhoud”
Reviews.Author: gert1947
Reviews.Content: Clean and decent room, a bit small but I understand this is normal for NY. Breakfast is ok, not luxerious The neighborhoud is really great, lots of restaurants, close to the subway and an easy walk to downtown Manhattan

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location but...”
Reviews.Author: planningjunetrip
Reviews.Content: The location is ideal, just across from the square and near shops and restaurants. The rooms are what you expect in NYC -- small but with everything you need. The only negative experience happened when we had the front desk make reservations for us at the hotel restaurant.... After walking down the block to get to the restaurant (we had to use the outside entrance because of needing a handicapped entrance) the restaurant had no record of our reservation and were unable to serve us. In all it's a nice place but totally unsuitable for anyone traveling with physical challenges. No wheelchair entrances, many stairs, poor access. That's not unusual for boutique hotels but you'd think in today's world these things would get more attention,

Reviews.Title: “Great location away from all the tourist hotels uptown”
Reviews.Author: marvic140908
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December and had a great break. The location of the hotel is second to none. It is just by the square and very close to the great bars and eateries of Greenwich village. It is far enough away from the tourist traps uptown but close enough to explore Manhattan by foot. The room we had was at the back, it wasn't the biggest of rooms but was clean and very warm. The bathroom was nice as was the shower and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel bar was great and relaxing. The breakfast was basic but good. We would stay here again if and when we return to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but Disappointing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: empax
Reviews.Content: The location CANNOT be beat, right in the heart of Washington Square. However, this hotel leaves much to be desired. I got there and there was NO shower curtain, just an annoyance when you are traveling for work to have to call about this. Also, the A/C is a window unit and really doesn't work. I am not someone who even uses A/C that often, but when it is 95 in NYC, you need it. Further, it was clear this used to be a smoking room and still smells heavily of stale smoke. It might be OK in the winter, but will not be staying here again. I was sad, since it is close to my NY office and I really wanted this place to rock!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location,the hotel and the staff”
Reviews.Author: Gem413
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late, but we had a great welcome from the staff on the reception desk. The location was everything we wanted, we could walk to many places and we walked a lot!!! The hotel is also also close to 2 subway stations and we used them a lot too. Our room was clean and comfortable. We enjoyed our breakfast every day. The dining room sometimes got crowded, but the hotel staff usually manage this well. We had a great time and will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “great place, I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Annapanna100
Reviews.Content: Great area to live at, next to NY University campus and Washington Square. nice staff free wifi. I got a big room, nice view, big bathroom. Very comfortable bed. Clean. The breakfast was not very good, I stayed here for a bit more than a week and skipped breakfast all days except for 2....

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: siktybaht
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the front desk at 11am which was still some hours before the 1500 check in time but the woman at the front desk was kind enough to give us our room. The room was on the second floor and although this meant no skyline view, it was still a nice room - and big, and clean. Continental breakfast in the small but charming cafe s no-fill, no-fuss which is how we wanted it. Just across the road is the lovely Washington Square Park which is lovely in a hot summer day. And its proximity to 5th Avenue allowed us to walk to Empire State Building and all the nice, quirky places in between. Shame we were only staying overnight but would definitely come back to this hotel next time we are in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and to see locals in their habitat!”
Reviews.Author: Frequentraveler36
Reviews.Content: Location provided quiet evening, options for entertainment, eating and people watching! European in environment, i.e., appeared to have a number of foreign travelers. Rooms are small by chain-type hotels but charming. Everything worked in the work. They had just made available new instant coffee machines...from expresso to regular! Would stay here again on next visit to NYC...nice to visit Times Square but great to stay in the Village.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for our many visits to Manhatten”
Reviews.Author: 56003Nancy
Reviews.Content: My friend and I love staying at the Washington Square Hotel. We love being in this part of Manhatten and across the street from the park, within walking distance of great restaurants and shopping. The rooms are small but considering the amenities, most of all the cost, who cares. The staff is always helpful, the look of the place cheers me. It makes for a terrific New York experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a very central location”
Reviews.Author: JdbE
Reviews.Content: The Washington Square Hotel is a wonderful hotel to stay in if you want to visit all the main attractions of Manhattan. I stayed here with my mother and sister. We had a very large room that was comfortable and had a view at the Washington Square. This is rare for a hotel in Manhattan, even more so considering the very reasonable price we paid for the stay. The hotel is situated in a quiet street, so absolutely no noise at night, we enjoyed some quality sleeping time! The people at the lobby are helpful, and there is a great bellboy who knows his way around the village. Skip the breakfast, just head into the streets next to the hotel for some great places to eat. Would definitely stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelswithdogs
Reviews.Content: This will be my go-to place in NYC in the future - okay, rooms were small, view was of the wall, but that's to be expected - and who goes there to hang out in the room, anyway? One obnoxiously noisy pair of guests, but that was not the hotel's fault.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable hotel in fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: TallyLassie100
Reviews.Content: The Washington Square Hotel is a great little hotel right on Washington Square in Greenwich Village. It has a wonderful bar and delicious food at its restaurant. The staff are all friendly and you are within walking distance of some of NYC's most fun neighborhoods.

Reviews.Title: “Easy location, clean Manhattan room. May return next trip.”
Reviews.Author: Jedi-Elvis
Reviews.Content: Pro's: simple to find by car, subway, foot or cab; super helpful bellstaff, clean rooms (they use cotton blankets that were freshly laundered, so we did not need to immediately throw off a filthy bedcover), comfy bed in a decent sized room, locker for laptop while they held our bags, continental b-fast, easy walk into west village & other neighborhoods. Con's: standard Manhattan list; tight hallways & elevator; pay to park in a nearby garage.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel - fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: lizzy75-1
Reviews.Content: we stayed five nights at the WSH and found it to be everything it promised. the rooms were clean and comfortable, they were not huge but then having read other reviews whinging about them we were very happy with the size. the room we had faced the street but it was not noisy, we slept with the window open most nights. the staff, particularly ronnie on the front door were very helpfull. the location is superb, you can walk to soho, chelsea, west village and there is a subway around the corner, restaurants and bars are everywhere. would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: ColeandFletcher
Reviews.Content: Communal areas are stunning with many original features, location is fabulous, but rest of hotel is in dire need of a refurb! Room safe never worked for our entire stay of 5 nights despite telling reception on several occasions. The window blinds are all frayed and very tatty, the window curtains are for show only so do not close!! The carpet was very shabby. Such a shame as this hotel could be absolutely fabulous - it just needs a little TLC

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable - and disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Thefiveyeargang
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Washington square Hotel, we could not believe it when they put us in room 125 on the ground floor right next to the reception and in the corridor that lead to the breakfast room and restaurant. the noise was unbearable on the stone floor, all the people coming in throughout the night 3am, 4am, 5am and then the porter who came on around 6am, turned on his radio - which was the last straw. The Washington Square hotel should not use rooms 125 and 124 unless they put a door between reception and these rooms and carpet on the floor. Also the rooms are tiny, but with a big price tag.... the bathroom was a joke, I could sit on the toilet wash my feet in the bath and wash my hands in the sink! what a disgrace, we will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: ktyflp
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here one night, I wish we had stayed longer. Great staff, cozy, clean rooms, and fantastic location right next to Washington Square park. If I get the opportunity to go back to New York I will definately stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: turquoise_racoon
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel and always recommend it - location and price is always good each time I have stayed, plus great celebrity spots at breakfast!!

Reviews.Title: “Management made good on booking mix up”
Reviews.Author: LightPro
Reviews.Content: I had booked four nights at this property as I have stayed here before and had a very good experience. I called the day of my arrival and the receptionist said they did not have me due until the next day and they were fully booked for that evening. Despite my e-mail confirmation stating my arrival date, the receptionist could do nothing. I asked to speak with the manager and she very kindly offered to book me at a near by hotel, which I gladly accepted. The next day I checked into the WSH and the manager comped me full breakfast for my remaining days. This is excellent service and I will return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely friendly hotel ,excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Riversdale04
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel - we did our research on Tripadvisor . We arrived to a warm welcome - room was not ready but our luggage was whisked away . After a look around we were delighted with the location and when we arrived back, our room was ready. We were disappointed that our room was right next to the lift and were going ask to be moved -but it proved not be a problem at all. The break fast was good & free ! It was extremely cold in New York during our trip and we found The Washington Square so cozy with lovely helpful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff and good value”
Reviews.Author: CzarinaPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is art deco charming. Ronnie at the front door serves as security, doorman and concierge. He gave us helpful dining and activitiy suggestions and really understood our needs. The front desk staff was helpful as well. Our rooms were quiet for sleeping at our request. We did not face the street. The hotel was kept very clean. The included continental breakfast is convenient.

Reviews.Title: “liberal use of mirrors can only hide so much: think small”
Reviews.Author: MichaelInSF
Reviews.Content: liberal use of mirrors can only hide so much: think small I just finished a two night stay at Washington Square Hotel while doing business a couple blocks away. Location was indeed very excellent. Not far from super hip SoHo & Bleeker Street and only a block or so away from the 4th avenue Subway station. For being a relatively small (for New York) and extensively renovated hotel building, there's a lot going on in there. When you look at the reservation form, it appears that there are nine different kinds of rooms available. They also have two elevators and three stairways. All crammed into that one building. As mentioned in the title of my review, the folks that did the thorough renovating made very liberal use of mirrors & soft earth tones to give a very effective illusion that the rooms are bigger than they really are. There's only so much they can do with limited real estate. The room my office reserved for me, if I had to guess what they booked, was likely the "Double Bed Deluxe". The actual room that I slept in, next to one of the elevator shafts, was incredibly small, with one small window with at least the bottom third covered up by an A/C unit and an even smaller window in the bathroom. The room was very clean and very well maintained. A couple maintenance issues that I discovered and reported to the front desk were taken care of before I returned from my day outside. There's a "iHome" iPad clock stereo radio next to the bed that has a plug that allows input from other mp3 players. Room safe was very compact and while it has two shelves which comfortably fit iPods, wallets, and other small devices, it isn't big enough to hold any laptops. The closet also held a small ironing board and iron. No terry cloth bath robe in my Deluxe room, even though a little placard said I could buy the robe from my room for $75. What? I guess that's a Superior class room amenity. I really appreciated that WiFi and Ethernet (cable is hidden in the top drawer of the cabinet) is free. The room next to mine was some kind of King room and I was impressed with the size of it -- at least 2 - 3 times bigger than my room, with a double sink in the bathroom. This helps to explain the crazy difference in reviews I can see here for this hotel: when you pay a bit more in the rate, you're likely to have a dramatically improved room size and overall experience. Like the other reviewers have noted, if you have a room next to the elevator you'll certainly hear noise periodically (the door opening / closing) and maybe some talking in the hallway but in general my room was quite quiet. And I was able to switch the A/C unit to "fan mode" which really assisted my sleep with some useful white noise and air circulation. Every guest gets access to the "continental" breakfast in the (also small) bar/lounge area. Continental breakfast consists of various pastries (bagels are cut into halves), some small bits of fruit (and whole apples or pears), cereal and yogurt. There are only a few tables in the lounge area so if you can't find a seat, just wait a few minutes and one will open up relatively quickly. I saw a "VIP breakfast" voucher sitting on one table (and looking at a review just below this one, they mentioned warm dishes like eggs), so I'm guessing that certain rates and/or guests get vouchers to go to the attached restaurant to get a more thorough breakfast experience. Gym is also small but functional. There were two treadmills, a cable / nautilus machine, some free weights, a bike and an exercise ball. Cameras *everywhere* in public areas (which feed to a big monitor down at the front desk), so you can have a good sense of security. There's a huge variety of restaurants one block away down MacDougal street, including Mamoun's famous falafel shop and a sub-street level Ethiopian restaurant named Meserkem (which I very much enjoyed). So to summarize: unlike most hotels where the difference between room rates and room types can be very subtle, the difference here can be very dramatic and if you find the prices not too different from one room type to another, investing in a better room type might mean a much better time. Was my small room worth the $500+ all-in for two nights that my company paid? I could probably have gotten a much bigger room for the same price at a chain hotel somewhere else on Manhattan, but then again I can't think of many (or any) chain hotels in casual walking distance of SoHo & Greenwich Village off the top of my head. And hotels on Manhattan are always pricey, anyways. It's one of those things I might be drawn into debating over drinks in the breakfast area… errr… WSH lounge. Hopefully this information helps you out. And if you did find useful information in my review, please let me know by clicking the "Helpful" link down below. Have a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, awesome restaurant”
Reviews.Author: CanadaOdie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the WSH for a couple of nights while in NYC for business. My room was small, but comfortable. The bathroom had been recently renovated. It's in an older building and is not sound-proof, but the bed was comfortable and I slept fine. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. I had dinner at the attached restaurant my first evening there. There was a mix-up and my meal took a long time to arrive. However, once it did, it was absolutely fabulous. One of the best restaurant meals I've ever had. They gave me free dessert to make up for the delay. I had a full breakfast included with my room. It was in the restaurant as well. First they brought out a large fruit bowl and a plate with a muffin, croissant, and bun. Then they brought orange juice and tea/coffee. Then they asked if I wanted cereal. Then they brought my order (usually pancakes, but there was eggs and the all regular breakfast menu things) --- this arrived with 3 huge pancakes and bacon. I've never seen such a huge breakfast. I walked around the neighbourhood, there's lots of shops and restaurants within about 10 minutes walk in any direction.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in New York's Greenwich Village”
Reviews.Author: mgwrite
Reviews.Content: I can't believe the negative reviews on this hotel, though I see that most of them are at least 2-3 years old, when the hotel was under a different management and before it was renovated and improved enormously. We had a fantastic 4 nights there, and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. It was clean, stylish, there are two excellent bars, a great breakfast and their North Square restaurant was incredibly good - we ate there one night. On the other nights we walked to various restaurants in Greenwich Village. The hotel's location couldn't be better, and next time we go to New York we will definitely try to book this place first. We were on the 4th floor overlooking the street and yes, there was a certain amount of street noise, but it wasn't that loud and this is New York after all. We moved on to a different hotel for our next 4 nights, where the street noise kept us awake, but that certainly wasn't the case here. We'd have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Top marks for location, service and value”
Reviews.Author: MatthewJB
Reviews.Content: Locaton - couldn't be better. On subway for A,C,E,F,M,B,D. One block further 1,2,3. Nearby restaurants a plenty. Service - friendly, low key, helpful doorman. The timing of the maid service is erratic, but cleaning was always thorough. Value - unbelievable for 2 double beds, closet and dresser, big bathroom and a view of the park. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “As Advertised - Great find in Great Location - Will be Back”
Reviews.Author: Codalover
Reviews.Content: I have regular business in the East Village area, and tried to make later reservations a couple of times and they were full. With good reason - this is a great little hotel. Room for $193/night - not huge but room for vanity table and closet. Bath and room were immaculate - shiny white tile that sparkled and great robes. Concierge in lobby is a hoot and really nice - I am not a Manhattan kind of gal and didn't feel out of place at all. Area is great as well - very safe for running, etc. and right on the park. Two great Mario Buttali restaurants - Otto and Babbo, are both within a block and I am embarrased to say that we hit both in one night as they are both fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has a lot of character and the location is great!”
Reviews.Author: scorney
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Washington Square Hotel for new Years Eve 2010. We were looking for a place that was affordable but clean and comfortable. The hotel has a great art deco jazzy feel. The customer service was great, and the room was comfortable. It was on the small side, but most rooms in NYC are so that was no big deal. Also, the walls are a little thin, but overall we really enjoyed our stay here. The cafe is really yummy too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel in West Village”
Reviews.Author: Jim_in_Virginia
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, small art-deco style hotel right on Washington Square. Room was smallish with no view but comfortable, clean, modern, with all the amenities, including terry robes. "Continental breakfast" included was nothing to rave about, but was adequate, and full breakfast was available. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Paid parking available a block away. Given the very reasonable rates, this one is a no-brainer for anyone visiting NYC. Bare-bones fitness room.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, clean, comfortable and a great value”
Reviews.Author: WJ083
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Washington Square Hotel on New Year’s Eve. It was a great experience and we highly recommend it. As with most hotel rooms in NYC our room was small but it was clean and bright and very comfortable. What a great use of the space. The bed was also comfortable and it was very quiet, a big plus for NYC. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and the value was also great. Last year we stayed at another hotel just a few blocks from there and it was over $200 more for the night and the room was noisy and not comfortable. The location was also great, very centrally located and an easy walk to most area attractions. Try it, you’ll like it.

Reviews.Title: “Cute boutique hotel in good area”
Reviews.Author: NycLovesToTravel
Reviews.Content: big enough room (For nyc standards), comfortable bed, friendly staff, good location if you like the downtown area- right near the subway which is a plus. Clean!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: trixmom
Reviews.Content: We were in NYC for a New Year's trip and this hotel was perfect! Very friendly staff, great location, and fun restaurant/bar downstairs. We will stay here again for our next trip to the city. Easy to walk great restaurants on Macdougal/Bleecker and also to Soho. The room was small but very comfortable - super great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MrsCosmo
