Reviews.Content: GREAT location!!! Close to Subway and a Duane Reade. In walking distance from Soho, Union Square and other great areas. Breakfast was somewhat boring, but there was lovely fresh fruit and boxes if you wanted to have take away breakfast – nice touch. We had plentiful and inexpensive breakfast at the Waverly Restaurant across from the Subway in stead. Our room was drafty but we were moved straight away. Also we asked for softer pillows and two single duvets in stead of a double and all was taken care of swiftly. We had a deluxe queen room overlooking the park. Our room was very spacious for NYC. Great value for money. Will definetly come back!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn’t swing a cat”
Reviews.Author: MIKEYDREAD
Reviews.Content: Smallest hotel room I’ve ever stayed in. Not enough room for 2 people’s clothes in the wardrobe. Difficult to get cool air in such a small area. Expensive compared with mid-town but the bars in the area seemed to be as well. Is it the artiness I ‘m paying for ie.connections with the Dylans etc.? I'm not naive enough to know that location is everything but really, I paid half as much the same week for the splendour of the Loews in New Orleans. Staff were nice enough except for the tall condescending bearded white guy in the bar. Think he’s been watching too much of Tom Cruise in Cocktail. Tall black unshaven bell was the opposite. Kept us right with directions and maps. Wish I could remember his name. Breakfast was forgettable. My wife left a quite expensive boot/shoe in the room and when I inquired by email later on to see if it had been found, I never received the courtesy of a reply. Going back to Lexington and Dillon’s bar on the last night reminded me what I was missing Wouldn’t go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cool vibe but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust321
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, close to many different subway lines so you can easily get to anywhere you want in Manhattan. It's half a block from Washington Square Park, which is a great place to sit outside and people watch if the weather is nice. Within walking distance to all the great shops in Soho. The rooms are a bit small, but for the money you pay for NYC, it's a good deal. Rooms were very clean and a bonus is that breakfast is included in the rate. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique style, and a wonderful experience.”
Reviews.Author: mtrwrks
Reviews.Content: From the moment you are escorted through the front doors of the Washington square hotel, you will feel like you've stepped back in time. The staff is wonderful, and the style is absolutely amazing. The rooms are smaller than you'd find in most chain motels, but hardly what I would consider cramped. They offer most of the modern conveniences, such as A/C, cable, and internet. You have to have an ethernet port if you want to use the in room internet. You can get wifi in the lounge area. I would be doing this hotel a disservice if I didn't mention cleanliness. This has to be one of the cleanest hotels I've ever had the pleasure of visiting. The WSH is the only hotel my wife and I will stay at when visiting the city. Great staff, fun atmosphere, clean rooms, and no bedbugs!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: hecls
Reviews.Content: When my friend suggested we were staying at the Washington I was sceptical at first...a boutique hotel in Manhattan made me think of cramped rooms, terrible service and no atmosphere... I couldn't have been more wrong. The hotel is located on the corner of Washington Square (the arch that looks like the Arc de Triumph/Marble Arch) and is in a very peaceful location considering the hustle and bustle of New York. The staff are friendly, rooms very clean, breakfast is provided and no sign of the dreaded NYC bed bug. The location is fantastic- the bottom of 5th Avenue, close to the subway- perfect! One fault- we ordered are taxi from the hotel to JFK- the cab driver was very rude and spoke on his phone in Spanish (rude spanish) all the way to the hotel, and was incredibly ungrateful when we provided him with more $ than required. (An airport tip- check in at the curbside, and tip about $10-$20 ...it is speedy, and you might get away with not having to pay for excess luggage.) The rooms are incredibly spacious, all with comfy beds, wardrobe, large bathroom, flat screen tv, toiletries, ironing board, iron, hair-dryer and safe. Plus they all have an art deco/female Hollywood icon theme.

Reviews.Title: “Aging, Small”
Reviews.Author: stone2
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for three nights with my wife. Room was small but I have been in smaller ones. Bathroom was especially small. It seemed clean. Window air conditional units. Nothing really modern here, Location is good. Very plain, very small, no wi fi in rooms. Terrible exercise area.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible room. Scratchy hospital sheets. Window ac barely worked”
Reviews.Author: traveler09895
Reviews.Content: Was excited about the location of this hotel. Interior is old and quirky. Small room had window ac unit and a hair dryer from 1970. The sheets were terrible, scratchy and the bed was only a double, even though it should have been a queen. For the price - $260 plus tax coming to $300, this was a disaster. Despite the convenience of the location, we will never stay here again. Much better to go to The Standard.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: helen187265
Reviews.Content: warm greeting, generous breakfast, room small, but with all commodities, well located, far from the huge tourist places near Times Square,yet close to bus and subway stations. The room was quiet, overlooking a small terrace, and with plenty of light as it was on the fifth floor. The only objection might concern rooms on lower floors that look out onto a wall, but as it was not the case for us we really had nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: March3000
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 deluxe rooms 6 months in advance to accommodate our two late teenage boys and ourselves. Our rooms were TINY, CLAUSTROPHOBIC and in dire need of maintenance and upgrading. Our room was on the second floor right above the entrance. It was quiet, but only because the air conditioner was so loud! This hotel is like a rabbit warren, so if you don't like tiny corridors, heavy iron doors and lack of air do not stay here. The bed sheets were not big enough for the mattress. The bottom sheet ended about 6"from the bottom of the bed so we could feel the mattress base ....totally gross. There is no fridge or mini bar in the rooms and a tiny TV with minimal channels. Our boys were put in a room on the same floor but through a heavy metal doorway and down a couple of corridors. I was freaking out about how we would get out in a fire or emergency. The staff at the front desk were incredibly grumpy with bland disinterested looks on their faces. The breakfast was disgusting and we did not eat anything after the fruit bowl was pretty much thrown on our table.

Reviews.Title: “Calm and cool in the heart of Greenwich Village”
Reviews.Author: paris19th
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights in this wonderful quaint hotel. Not big by any means, it probably has no more than 50 rooms. But they come at a premium because the place is kept very well and the location is ideal. It is diagonally across from Washington Square Park, adjacent to NYU buildings. Unlike many locations around the village, this area is pleasant to walk thru, not much traffic, and the streets are relatively clean. You are down the street from 6th ave, a major thoroughfare, and in proximity to major subway lines. About the hotel, it apparently used to be a dilapidated "crack" house in the '80s, but that is all history because the decor now is semi modern and classy. Not new mind you, but kept up very well. My room was done in an Art Deco style, done well and spotless. Fixtures in the bathroom were very modern and again clean. The staff and door people were extremely gracious, including the restaurant below which served up an amazing breakfast. Sorry I missed dinner there. Climate in the room was perfect. When I turned off the air, there was no lingering draft.One drawback was that the rooms contain window air conditioners, no central climatisation. So vents remain open in the units which allow a bit of noise from the street and a little draft at night. But again the street is very quiet. For an alternative to the big over sized midtown hotels, and for a few bucks more, it's well worth the experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - tiny room”
Reviews.Author: Gaynor73
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent place close to jazz clubs, theatres and restaurants. SOHO and Little Italy nearby. The staff were very helpful, especially the 'greeter/doorman'. Our only and biggest gripe was that the bedroom, though quiet, was very cramped, had no natural light and a very noisy AC unit (no opening windows which we didn't expect) which kept us awake. The room was described as 'superior' - superior to a broom cupboard maybe - just! My advice would be to book a twin bedded room. They did look bigger. Loved the art-deco lobby but were disappointed that while we were there the Parisian style bar never opened. Would recommend with warnings!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a Decent Price”
Reviews.Author: advturegrl200
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriends stayed at the hotel for four days, and we did not leave feeling cheated. While it was affordable, it is a definite trade off for space in your room. Everything was really clean and the staff were attentive. Most of all we love the location. Shopping in SoHo all day was a great start to our trip. Some great Thai food in the Meatpacking District at Spice. All within a 20 min walk. We also took the hop-on-hop-off bus tour around the city which I would suggest to any first timers like us. And on Friday night, just a couple of blocks from the hotel, we found this amazing lounge called 49 Grove. Great atmosphere with a really good crowd. We enjoyed vip bottle service and danced the night away. So if you are looking for a decent prices hotel in a great location, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “great location and price”
Reviews.Author: rambler601
Reviews.Content: If 'you get what you pay for' is true anywhere, it is here. Location is perfect for a trip to greenwich and the surrounds, and at this price, not too many grumbles. Small rooms and even smaller bathroom make it feel like a budget experience, but its all clean, and all you really need. However, it is noisy outside all night, so light sleepers might want to consider other options....not really much the hotel can do about this however! Staff were friendly and helpful, and the bell boys exceptionally friendly with good advice. There was a small bar and a decent continental breakfast each morning (nothing special or american....don't expect waffles or eggs or anything hot!). In summary, if you love greenich, soho, chelsea, and that kind of atmosphere, you'll probably love this hotel too; and it puts you right in the heart of all that.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable at the right time....”
Reviews.Author: mrwombat
Reviews.Content: My wife & I spent our first 4 nights (ever) in NYC at the Washington Sq Hotel in August. I had requested an upper floor room for peace & quiet after our 21 hour flight from Sydney. Our 2nd(!) floor room was quiet only because the NYU was on summer break (see later). The room itself was quite spacious, the king bed v. comfortable and the bathroom generous. The air con was, however, very noisy. Luckily we were so jet-lagged that it wasn't a problem. Breakfast was served in the restaurant under the hotel - more than enough food (cereal, breads, fruit, cooked eggs,if wanted). Hotel staff were as helpful as they needed to be, but didn't go out of their way to make our stay more enjoyable. Local restaurants in every flavour imaginable and easy walking. We walked to Meat Packing district one night without any problems (20 mins). Overall the hotel was satisfactory, had either old world charm or needed gutting, depending on your viewpoint but during university days it might be noisy (we returned to NYC two weeks later & dined nearby & it was noisy with students everywhere).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Marshmellow66
Reviews.Content: Hard to find fault really. Great hotel in an excellent position. Really safe and interesting neighborhood. We were two females and had absolutely no problem walking to restaurants at night as the area is full of students from NYU. Staff very helpful and breakfast is you didn't want the full works was more than adequate. Only downside was the noisy aircon unit but we only needed it for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location, small European style hotel”
Reviews.Author: GinDandy
Reviews.Content: I travel to NYC on business often and the typical $400++ cost is too much, so I am always looking for clean, reasonable hotels to try. This was recommended by a colleague. While not a luxury hotel, it was clean and neat. The staff was incredibly nice and accomodating. Rooms were on small side, and simply furnished, no frills.A good place to lay your head for a night and spend the extra money you save on a gourmet meal across the street at Babbo!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in the middle of the Village”
Reviews.Author: hayleyep
Reviews.Content: I read some of the reviews so was a little wary when I booked this hotel but actually found I couldn't fault it. It was alot better than I expected with the super friendly service of the doorman to the beautiful deluxe room with a view of the city and Hudson River. Loved the artwork in the room, was very clean and good sized for New York. Got a good night's sleep and good service from the fron desk staff too. Very happy, thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel in NYC.”
Reviews.Author: Dirkie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in Greenwich village nearby the Washington square arch. Metro is everywhere. In a day you see a lot (min. 4 or 5 days). Rooms with airco and our bathroom was renovated. We had breakfast and in the city you can eat everywhere. Do it with a tourguide.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: L0renz75
Reviews.Content: average quality hotel, greatly located, a little bit noisy: I asked for a "quiet" room, and I was given one at ground floor, not far from reception... 230$ for one night, with breakfast included (not high quality, and with no space to have.... we finally had in our room), seemed too much to me, but actually it was the best offer I found in Manhattan (3-4 stars hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Margee53089
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit ever to NYC. We stayed here for four nights in July 2010. We arrived at 5:30 PM and had a room on the 8th floor with a view of Washington Square Park. We took the advice of the concierge and ate dinner at Apple which was about 3 blocks away....very good! The room was compact but very clean and quiet. The location is key to do any exploring of NYC. You are just a few blocks from the subway and you are one block off of 6th Avenue. The neighborhood was a combination of residences and NYU students....it felt very safe. Many restaurants are within blocks and the park is a great place to hang out. The only issue we had was the lounge where the continental breakfast was always seemed to be closed. We didn't intend to eat there because Murray's Bagels is four blocks down 6th Avenue, but we would have liked to get a juice or something. I also thought the fitness center was part of the cost, but the guest book in the room made it seem like you had to pay extra for it. Not a big deal, however, we walked so much we were too tired to work out!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Essex_London
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 day loved that it was out of town a bit felt like we got to know a local side to New York loved the breakfasts and the rooms were lovely and quiet. Excellent concierge too!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location if you want to avoid the tourist hell of Midtown”
Reviews.Author: Bartonfields
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd stay at the WSH and I love the place. It's the perfect location away from busy midtown and on the edge of Greenwich Village. The area is wonderfully quiet especially at night. You also have Washington Square right on your door step, ideal for an early morning stroll or chillout anytime of day. The rooms are compact (but this is New York) and they are clean and presentable. Most of the rooms were updated a few years back. There's a couple of subways 5 mins walk in either direction and 4/5/6th avenues also a short walk away. I recommend this place to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “good service, good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Tenley
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because it was convenient for an event i was attending. The room was small but clean and well equipped (flat screen tv, robes, magnifiying make up mirror, ipod dock).there was no coffee maker, but they do serve breakfast). Staff was helpful, friendly and i was delighted to have room available even though i arrived early (noon). Breakfast was fine-- juice, coffee, fruit, croissants/breads, yogurt, cereal. More robust choices (eggs, smoked salmon, etc.) for an extra charge and the dining room pleasant enough. The air conditioner was a window unit so it was a little noisy but as i always take ear plugs with me that was not a showstopper. All and all, great location (Babbo is across the street, subway and starbucks around the corner, and the Square of course and NYU) and reasonable prices for new york. internet pre-pay was particularly good deal, though not refundable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: NatureGuyDECH
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lcoated in excellent part of town. Everything you want to see is close by. NYU is just in front of you and the village is right there for you to explore. It is great place to explore NYC. There are plenty of good and reasonable restuarants wihtin walking distance from the hotel. The staff was friendly. The room was clean and service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “OK - nothing special”
Reviews.Author: out8974
Reviews.Content: Clean, functional, right in the middle of the Village. Other than that, nothing memorable. Price was decent ($225) for small hotel in NYC at this time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for NYU and the Village”
Reviews.Author: mobycat
Reviews.Content: I had a job at NYU and this was the only hotel that I could find that wasn't at least 5 blocks away. It's not a bad hotel - but it is independent, as far as I can tell. So you aren't going to get a chain experience. The room was incredibly small - but this is New York and as I said... it's an independent hotel. The rooms are cooled via window air conditioners, so don't expect much of a view, even if you have a streetside room. Thankfully, the housekeeping staff did NOT turn off the A/C when they cleaned the room (that is a real pet peeve of mine when they adjust the heat/AC). Staff was friendly. I needed a cab at about 4:30pm (the worst time to try and find one in NYC). I was on the street for about 25 minutes with no luck. I went in to see if they could call one. The doorman went outside and started walking down the street to find one. Luckily, one came by right about that time. No, he didn't get one faster than I would have (that cab still would have passed whether he was there or not). But how many doorman are going to venture beyond 25 feet down the sidewalk for a guest? I did not have the experience of a recent poster - it was not loud at all. The toilet paper was fine. The bed was FAR from hard (I actually prefer firmer beds, so I would have loved a hard bed). I was there the day Apple released the iPhone 4 - and while I was having cell phone connection problems in general (all over Manhattan), they were no worse in the the hotel. I didn't use the breakfast or any of the food options in the hotel proper.

Reviews.Title: “Not worht the price”
Reviews.Author: love2byke
Reviews.Content: The only reason to stay here is location. It's within safe walking distance of the Village, Soho, Little Italy and more but is it worth the exorbitant price? NO! It was noisy, the room was extremely small and claustrophobic, the mattress was hard, even the toilet paper/tissues were of the cheap variety...like sandpaper. I couldn't get a cell phone signal in my room and thus could not make or receive calls unless outside. The continental breakfast was lacking....bagels, cold cereal, fruit, yogurt...they didn't even provide half and half for coffee unless you asked for it and no daily newspaper was provided for each guest....if you were lucky, a portion of newpaper was sitting on a table as you entered the basement breakfast room. The upstairs lounge was hardly ever open....it's mainly for tea and closed at 3pm; most people would be out and about the city when it was open. I would rather take a taxi and be a little out of my way than spend $580 for two nights in this conveniently located hotel with no amenities at all.

Reviews.Title: “BEST WEST VILLAGE LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: TessTalks
Reviews.Content: For thirty years I lived a few blocks from the Washington Square Hotel, so when my husband and I wanted to visit NYC for three days to celebrate my 65th birthday, we decided to stay at the newly refurbished hotel. We couldn't have made a better choice. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful, the rooms are small, but the Art Deco decor is so nice you forget about the size, and we were out most of the day anyway. The in-room safe was very handy, and terry cloth robes, an iron and hair dryer were also provided. The beds were very comfortable, with very nice down quilts. The room and entire hotel is clean, clean, clean. The complimentary breakfast was an extra bonus, and a wonderful way to start the day, with an excellent selection of rolls, fruit, bagels, little pastries, cereal and yogurt. The Washing Square Hotel will be our place to stay for all our future NYC visits.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about location”
Reviews.Author: Eva The Hague
Reviews.Content: - The location was perfect, 2 minutes from the subway, great neighbourhood. - The rooms were quite small, but nice and clean. -The street noise was absolutely horrible. This problem could be solved by changing to double glazed windows and not single glazed fixed with Sellotape (Scotch tape)... - The bed was extremely uncomfortable, we slept very badly!!! - The self service breakfast was poor and boring and for the served breakfast (for extra cost!!!) we needed to wait 15-20 minutes before we could even be seated. - The staff was OK. Not very friendly, sometimes rude and surely hated their job. One or two of them were absolutely lovely though! All in all, if I'm in New York the next time I am not going back to this hotel any more.

Reviews.Title: “Old and charming”
Reviews.Author: PKBadger
Reviews.Content: If you want a place that is off the beaten path, but still in a great location and close to subway stations, Washington Square is great. The rooms are not large, but it is lovely, has breakfast included, and has a warm, comfortable feeling.

Reviews.Title: “charming, comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: foundnotlost
Reviews.Content: We arrived here after being ripped off by a non-yellow cab (please dont learn the hard way like us-take a yellow cab!) and were very pleasantly surprised with this hotel. There was some building work going on in the square but it was still a lovely open location which made it really peaceful. Its extremely close to the Greenwich/ Soho cool shops and really close for Bleaker Street. Everything else is within walking distance or easy to get to from the nearest subway station. We had booked for a deluxe double which on the webiste was a little more expensive but said it would have either a city or park view. The first room they gave us had a tiny window and a view of a drain and brick wall...although this is quite common in New York we had specifically chosen this hotel and paid a bit extra because of the chance of a view. The reception were very accomodating and found another room which was absolutely perfect, large for New York standards and had two lovely big windows were we could see the park and the city a little bit. The breakfast is great, you can either have table service in the restaurant, where you get a large choice of things brought to you, or if you want you can have it in the lounge where you can help yourself, and sometimes there is a bit more variety. All the staff were very friendly and very helpful. The interiors are really quite lovely, everything is clean and well kept. Greenwich itself is a great place to be based as its low rise so its bit calmer than uptown and times square. Some cool restaurants to try are: Johns Pizzeria (branch in soho, and times square- this is a converted chapel) - massive yummy pizza, very good value for money Fannellis cafe in soho - great food, bit like Cheers on the decor Joes Shanghai - long wait so get there early, also its quite crazy and you will be sat at a table with strangers, but the dumplings are amazing ( their speciality) and so are their other dishes - try the greens..massive portions and cheap! Del Friscos - up market steak house next to the Rockafella Centre, quite pricey but the most amazing steak and sides, and a wine list of over 2000 wines.. The Mercer Hotel kitchen - very cool interiors, yummy food, quite pricey but yummy cocktails Just to mention a few.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about location”
Reviews.Author: CERAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Right on the corner of one the places to be in NY. Very convenient location for NYU. Close to subwaystation (with several lines up and downtown) and within walkingdistance of Bleekerstreet, Meatpacking, Soho. As mentioned before the inner rooms are dark. The ones facing Waverly place are good and quiet. I didn't find the staff very cheerfull or helpfull, but price/quality is really good.

Reviews.Title: “Location and kindness”
Reviews.Author: nmqueen
Reviews.Content: I traveled to NYC for the first time in 30 years for a conference at NYU. This hotel was three minutes away from the conference site. The rooms were small but very clean. The inside rooms were dark, but extremely quiet and comfortable. We moved on the last night to a quad room to share and were upgraded to a corner room with views of the park. This was a very large room for NY standards and quite nice. At night, however, the room was noisy as I believe we were over the entrance/exit to the bar. There was also a great deal of street noise. Not being used to this kind of noise, none of us slept very well. The hotel staff were very nice and accommodating. The upgrade was unexpected and welcome. The continental breakfast was adequate. The neighborhood was wonderful with all kinds of quaint little restaurants at a reasonable price for NY. A subway stop is just one block from the hotel and one night we made it back from the theater on 42nd street to the hotel in about 15 minutes. We made the mistake of eating at a deli in the theater district and a sandwich was $27! We had a full Chinese meal near the hotel for that price. I accidentally left some clothes in the closet and the housekeeping staff have been wonderful about returning them to me. We had a great time, and I hope to return soon with the husband and the kids. This is a great location to come home to while exploring NYC. Thanks everyone at Washington Square Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Tired”
Reviews.Author: LilacjoMa
Reviews.Content: My daughter was accepted to NYU early and we were invited to attend an information session. Typically I stay at The Mercer, 60 Thompson, The Crosby, The Bowery. Thought this was worth a try and a great location. I really wanted to be ok with it as it is so close to all things NYU. Sweetest doorman...and kind front desk. It stops there. Rooms are VERY tired. Our room was on the first floor and very loud. Truthfully, I would have left but my daughter was so glad to be at NYU I made it through the night. Not again.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!! only draw back is the prices are getting too high”
Reviews.Author: TiaNFl
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Washington Square Hotel several times and love this hotel. The staff has always been helpful and pleasant. This is a kid friendly hotel although I would say more for teenagers and mature children. Not a place for little kids to be running around screaming. The rooms are small but this is typical for NYC hotels. We have stayed at other hotels including the Waldorf and the size is standard at most hotels. The rooms are clean and in good shape. It is also quiet here allowing you to get a good night’s sleep before pounding the pavement for great deals the next day. The restaurant has good food and the bar has great drinks. Bartenders are friendly and accommodating. The continental breakfast in the morning is one of the best around!! The location is the best especially if you want to stay in the Village and be located near China town, Little Italy, NYU etc... Restaurants in the area are WONDERFUL. The ONLY downside to this hotel is their prices are getting a little too high which is very unfortunate b/c we would really prefer to stay here however with the economy the way it is, you have to save money where you can. It would be nice if those signed up on their mailing lists would be offered discounts from time to time but I have been signed up for years and never received anything. All in all I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Washington Square Hotel is a super place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Metaldave
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent area. You have a subway 2 minutes walk from the front door that will have you up town in 10 minutes or down town in 5 minutes. Staying down in the village area is a big change from where we stayed last time (7th Ave and 34th St) you get to see the residential side of NY, you get a real feel for the city life. The staff at the hotel are incredibly helpful in pointing out what's open etc, for example we set out on the Tuesday morning to go to the Museum of Modern Art and the chap on the door (I didn't catch his name unfortunately) told us that it was actually closed that day. He also told us all the places to eat etc near by. The breakfast is ample to get you started on your day. The rooms are very clean and well maintained everyday. The hotel is only a few minutes walk from Bleeker St which is a super night spot! We would definitely stay here when we return to New York! I can't recommend this hotel enough!

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, spacious rooms and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Margotlc
Reviews.Content: We could not have asked for a better location in New York. We loved being just next to Washington Square, a stone throw away from 5th Avenue and Soho and the price is just right for someone who doesnt have money to throw away. The rooms are a generous size, the beds where really comfortable and the shower had plenty of hot running water. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would probably return. Our only complaint is that some of the staff in reception did not really have their heart on their job and came across as unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Washington Square - standards are slipping....”
Reviews.Author: Deaks
Reviews.Content: I returned to this NYC hotel in October 2009 for old-times' sake really. Way back on my first ever trip to NYC I stayed here and enjoyed it, so eight years later it was time to go back. Initial impressions remain positive. Well-positioned near the bohemian Greenwich Village, the hotel's located down a quiet-ish side street (Waverly Place) and is two minutes trek at most from the subway station. The subway station is served by the line directly to the JFK Airport station so that's an added bonus, and there's a great diner across the street. Check-in was friendly and quick. Unfortunately it would seem that not a lot, if any, work has been done to the rooms since 2001, although they remain comfortable and have free, quick internet via a cable supplied by the hotel. My one real gripe was service, and cleanliness. Obviously the room I stayed in was not vacuumed by the maid, and 'evidence' would suggest little other than making the bed was carried out. Surprisingly a bin wasn't provided in the room. That said, one doesn't really expect the previous day's McDonald's wrappers and newspapers to still be present when returning after a day's exploring - so, it would seem, a little/lot of work could be done in that area. For the price - over $200 dollars per night for a single room - it's not really good enough. That said, I'd probably stay there again....

Reviews.Title: “Small but very charming”
Reviews.Author: jenniferbarba
Reviews.Content: I love the bed. It's a tiny room, but then it's New York. The bed is very comfortable and the linens were absolutely a delight to sleep on. The location is perfect too. It's right at the heart of Greenwich Village, with loads of history surrounding the area. We love the old charm feel of its interiors. We, however, were not very keen about the breakfast, it was quite disappointing actually. But for the price, location and comfort by New York standards, this is not a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “it was okay”
Reviews.Author: KPH66
Reviews.Content: I booked the WSH for business and had an okay stay. I requested a deluxe room with street view and was placed in a room at the back of the hotel which looked out on to a wall so I asked to be moved. They did so and I was placed in a room looking over the side street - not quite the view over the park that I hoped for. The room itself was okay but really lacking in facilities - no tea or coffee making facilities, no refrigerator to put a cold drink in and just very basic I guess. The air conditioning unit was very noisy and we had to have this on because the windows did not have screens to keep mosquitoes out. The corridors were really ugly and I wonder if they will ever freshen these up. A paint job and new carpets could really do wonders for this place. The breakfast included in the rate was basic and it would have been really nice to have a toaster so you could heat up those bagels! The breakfast room itself was really cold and lacking in atmosphere and you never really felt like hanging around. Overall, it was okay but I was really hoping it would be much nicer. The location was great and the lobby staff were pleasant and helpful. I probably would not stay here again because it just wasnt that special.

Reviews.Title: “Great area, super hotel”
Reviews.Author: gregtraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Washington Square Hotel for five nights in October and was thrilled with the hotel. I was travelling with my mother and our request for a twin room was accomodated. We had paid the extra for a deluxe room and it seemed well worth it as we saw other rooms with windows that appeared to only open out onto brick walls! Our bathroom was a good size and we even got bath robes. The area was quiet but still had a good buzz. There were loads of nearby restaurants of all prices and the hotel staff were always ready to offer advice and recommendations. We got some good tips from them. The complimentary breakfast was a good bonus and, though not amazing, it did the job. As it was included in the cost there wasn't much to complain about. All in all, we had a great stay. I will certainly stay there the next time I travel to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: MaryfromBristol
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel located in beautiful Greenwich Village. Right next to Washington Square (buskers/chess players/trees!) and close to all the restaurants in Greenwich Village. About 5 minutes walk from the famous Bleeker Street. Much nicer than staying in Uptown. The walk to Top of the Rock takes about an hour or a taxi is just $10 (cheaper than subway or bus if there are four of you travelling together. We were really pleased we stayed here - the beds (2 large doubles) were really comfortable and the bathrooms (We stayed in a quad room for three nights and twin and double for one as the quad was unavailable for the first night) ranged from sumptuous (Delux double) to just fine (double). The quad room number 120 is at street level and yes you do hear street noise - but this is New York and we were so tired after busy days doing exciting things that we all slept well. The bathrooms all had plenty of towels and free shampoo/conitioner/body lotion/soap. Breakfast was delicious - fruit salad, home baked pastires, good coffee and orange juice, cereal and yogurt.. The staff including the freindly doorman were all helpful and booked a taxi to the airport at the end of the stay to Newark for $62. Cheaper than getting a yellow cab and more roomy when you need to take all your baggage. The best attractions we visited were top of the rock and it's worth getting the daytime/sunset deal (we didn't and ended up paying twice) sunset over Manhattan has to be one of the world's most exciting views. The MOMA was one of the best art collections I've ever seen - 5th floor for all the Picassos,and Matisses - wonderful. Staten Island Ferry - free and great for skyline views. Our teenagers loved the Record shops in Thompson Street - nothing like it in the UK any more. Loads of good places to eat near the hotel and a Staples for online checkin just around the corner. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone and would book again without hestiation. But if you want sterility and double glazing go somewhere else - you can hear street noise and that kind of thing annoys you you might be better off staying Uptown.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: bellisimo
Reviews.Content: we arrived on a wednesday evening and received a warm welcome.....we had requested a room on the upper floors with a nice view and the hotel accomodated our request. we absolutely loved this hotel...it is very quaint and the service from the front desk to the bellman to the restaurant servers was fantastic......room is not large but it is very comfortable and clean and the location can't be beat....within walking distance of restaurants, night life, shopping.......a real gem in nyc.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: RHW4
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel to be told our rooms were not ready - we had to for around an hour and a half for both of our two rooms to be ready for us. The staff weren't all that apologetic and didn't seem that bothered about the fact that we had to wait - so not a good start! Once we did get into our rooms however we were happy with the size and comfort - a safe, hairdryer, ice bucket and bathrobes are all provided. There wasn't very much natural light in our room but that has to be expected for new york city as our window was close to another building, but this wasn't too much of a problem. The rooms were cleaned daily and the free breakfast in the mornings was good - the staff in the restaurant are very helpful and polite. you also have the option of ordering a cooked breakfast at reasonable charges if you don't want the free breakfast. The best thing about this hotel is definitely the location - a two minute walk round the corner and you're on fifth avenue! Washington Square is absolutely gorgeous in the morning when it's really quiet. Our body clocks never quite adjusted to the time difference so we were often up and about at 6.30 - 7am and took the opportunity to explore the square and the surrounding areas with the only the local dogwalkers around. We went to a local coffee shop and got a drink and a snack to eat in the park every morning, which was really nice and peaceful - highly recommended! Overall a good place to base yourself while in New York, recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Traveller79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at WSH for 5 nights with a friend. We found the Village area to be nice and relaxing compared to the constant bustle of Times Square and it's surroundings. The hotel it self was clean, the complimentary breakfast was a good way to start a busy day of sightseeing and shopping and the rooms were small but in NYC not bad. The staff were very nice and professional and we enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, attentive staff & good coffee!!”
Reviews.Author: mel_0404
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here for 4 nights last year, and found the rooms to be comfortable -yes - very small, and somewhat dated, but comfortable. And after a very long flight from Australia, the inclusion of a full sized tub in the bathroom was a welcome inclusion. The day concierge was extremely helpful & attentive and the biggest surprise (for me) was the quality of the coffee! Convenient location - we had no problems finding our way around and it really didn't take very long to get to anywhere we wanted to go. I would definitely stay in the Village again - it's a great place to base yourself in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: Shuffs
Reviews.Content: Firstly, this is in a great location. Right in the middle of Greenwich Village within walking distance of lots of good bars and restaurants. Bleeker Street especially. From this hotel, we wetre in easy reach of everything NYC could offer. We even got the metro direct to Coney Island! We had a deluxe room which had plenty of space. Nice view of Washington Square too. Couldn't fault it. Service was always good and breakfast was perfect (we don't eat much in the morning so a couple of bagels was enough).

Reviews.Title: “LOVE the WSH!!!!”
Reviews.Author: acannada
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July as well as August. We love this area. It is close to wonderful restaurants, great shops, and great green spaces. The subway is conveniently near. The complimentary breakfast is a great plus. The rooms aren't huge....but who stays in their room in NYC? The staff is friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay here again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at the Washington Square Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FussyOnion
Reviews.Content: We came to New York to visit in June, this being our third visit to the city. We decided we wanted to stay in Greenwich Village and hotel choice in this area was pretty limited so we opted for the Washington Square after reading reviews on tripadvisor. Although the hotel is a bit tired in places, this is a charming little hotel with some lovely art deco touches. Our room was one of the interior rooms as we preferred to have "quiet" over a view. It certainly was quiet as well, we did not hear a peep from outside or from anyone else in the hotel. Our room was very small and I would have liked to have a little more closet space but this was a small price to pay for being located in Greenwich Village. So much to see and do just on the hotels doorstep. The staff were also friendly and welcoming, always a goodbye or hello when leaving or entrering the hotel. With regards food, we only ate breakfast at the hotel, this was plentiful and you could also order cooked extras should you prefer. There are simply hundreds of places to eat nearby - I am a vegetarian and had a fantastic meal at a place called "Gobo", just around the corner from the hotel. We also went on one of the many food tours of the area - this was a great way to spend the day. Overall, a great stay at the Washington Square hotel - I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel in Fab Area”
Reviews.Author: prestigeproducts
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 4th stay at the WSH. I read some of the other reviews, and have to say that we have stayed in both the deluxe and standard rooms and although the rooms are small, we're more than happy with the size. The last room we stayed in had a particularly small closet, but we simply put our luggage under the desk and it was out of the way. We weren't bothered by the thin shower curtain either, although I'd like to see the rod hung a bit lower to keep more water in. We love the WSH - the lobby is spacious, the staff friendly and professional (with the exception of Ronnie, who talks a mile a minute and tries to convince us to eat at restaurants we've no interest in - I think he gets a kick back for recommending certain places), the location is wonderful, and everything is CLEAN. Some reviewers complained about breakfast - I don't know what they're used to eating, but for us, a bowl of muffins/scones/bagels and yogurt, cereal and fresh fruit is plenty. We've also ordered off the regular menu and haven't been disappointed. The orange juice is always freshly-squeezed, and their coffee and tea is freshly brewed. We've also had some of the bar food - their guacamole is fresh and obviously made in the kitchen. The drinks are reasonably priced and the staff is courteous and professional. The best part about WSH? You can cross the street to Babbo restaurant and if you get there about 4:45 pm and wait at the door, you can be seated at a table near the bar and have the most astoundingly good meal. We do this every time we stay here, and sometimes 2 nights in a row. The food is THAT good. Cons? Small spaces - if you are an overly large person, you probably won't feel comfortable here. The elevators are small, the rooms are small, the corridors are small. Definitely not made for the plus-sized traveler. I was squashed in the corner of the elevator by a plus-sized couple and it wasn't fun.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in the heart of true New York”
Reviews.Author: Eddiecat
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpfull hotel staff. Delux room we had was smaller than many American hotel/motel rooms, but good for a New York city hotel. Excellent location near a subway and lots of restaurants/bars/clubs in Greenwich Village. Good complimentary breakfast. Stay here if yuo want to experience a more authentic New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain...will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: ginafly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last winter and found it to be a very good value for the money. The neighborhood is about as good as it gets. The lobby is attractive, service friendly. My one complaint would be the lack of modern climate control in the rooms. This is very common in Manhattan, but still makes for an uncomfortable sleep. We actually had to turn on the AC in the middle of February because the room was so hot and there was no way to open a window. Other than that, a wonderful stay...small rooms of course, but it's Manhattan, what does one expect?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location. Exceptionally friendly staff. Clean--- but very small rooms!”
Reviews.Author: EnglishRusty
Reviews.Content: We arrived early from JFK (i.e. about 13:00) and the rooms (3 doubles weren't ready) although to be fair that was our fault not theirs. The luggage was locked away securely and the statff/conceige could not have been more helpful. They arranged a bus tour of the city which was perfect. We arrived back at about 17:00 and went to the rooms. They were all immacuately clean but be warned, especially if you have an internal one, they are very very small. We had three cases as we were due to go off on the QM2 and it took some ' juggling' to sort where they could live. Two afternoons of shopping didn't help!!! Breakfast was good but set. Bagels. Fruit. Cereal. All in all a good choice. 5 min walk from Broadway / 20 mins from China Town / 30 mins from Ground Zero. Also perfectly located for Greenwich Village which we all wished we had more time to explore. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It's okay, just not special or as good as we expected.”
Reviews.Author: hannahx200
Reviews.Content: Overall satisfied but not enough to consider recommending it to any friends or staying again. We were expecting the small room sizes (and the middle range room really is small, there's nowhere to put the suitcase as the wardrobe is too small and there's no space for a stand!) and it was extremely clean. There were however quite a few niggles. One day we arrived back to see the maids still making up the rooms at 4.30pm - ours hadn't been done and as we didn't feel like going out again we had to flick it to do not disturb and go without. This seems riddiculously late to be doing the cleaning up. Another gripe was that whilst they do provide some free wi-fi access there is no shared computer, we traveled without a wi-fi enabled device and at the other 3 places we stayed at a computer was provided for checking emails and other small things. The TV had few channels and didn't have an inbuilt menu where you can see what's coming up in the next couple hours, I'd rarely complain about TV but again this was something we had had in our other stays. The breakfast was also amazingly limited, a small basket of pasteries to share between two, a small bowl of melon and one glass of orange juice. I realise it's rare for a hotel to offer breakfast but we expected a continental breakfast to be buffet style (one of their 2 rooms you are waited on) with the feeling you can have more than 1 serving. One day we escaped for waffles at the nearby diner just to start the day on a full stomach. Finally the bathroom had the cheapest, flimsiest shower curtain possible, so that it clung to your body and then all the water escaped into a giant puddle on the floor. The reception staff were very mixed in their helpfulness, on one occasion we needed to do flight check in at 10.30pm and had to ask at reception for the nearest late internet café, the staff on duty very grumpily told us to take two rights and there's a place that might still be open. Luckily it was but they really didn't seem too concerned. Although when we checked out we did have a helpful lady who told us they could look after our luggage and booked us a car to the airport. The cocktail bar was incredibly difficult to find, we had to ask at reception, which is a shame as the drinks were lovely and quite cheap ($9).The barmaid was very friendly but we definitely got the impression she wished more people knew about it. Generally this hotel is in a good location with good transport links around NY, we just felt it was a tad overpriced. Having stayed at a lovely B&B in Brooklyn earlier in our holiday for $75 less a night with massive rooms and delightful service we would happily take the 30 minute subway ride from Brooklyn to the centre over staying in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, excellent price, wholly recommend it to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: Dubtrip
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Washington Square hotel for 6 nights on a trip to visit friends and see the city. I had read reviews on Trip Advisor that warned of noisy rooms near the lift so was relieved to find ours was as far away as could be. The room was big enough for us (we are British so don't expect huge spaces) and was well equipped with safe, ironing board, hair dryer etc. The bathroom was compact but clean, and that's all you ever truly want from a bathroom anyway! The bed was really comfy and the air conditioning was as cold as needed to recover from stomping around a sticky city. The staff on the front desk as well as the lobby staff were helpful and polite, and there's free wifi in the lobby and the cafe, which served a decent cup of tea from 3pm. There was also a gym if you're that way inclined. The best thing about this hotel is the price for the location, you truly can't be in a better spot to get to anywhere in the city and beyond. I used to live in NYC and the park and surrounding area couldn't be anymore different from the past, almost sterile, and totally safe. Absolutely stay here, and have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: lgelkins
Reviews.Content: We went for a quick overnight getaway to the Washington Square Hotel. The location was amazing, and we really enjoyed strolling through the adjacent park. For creative food, boutique shopping, and neighborhood walks, this is the best area of the city. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. However, the rooms are on the small side. We asked for the larger king room, and fortunately, there was one available. The decor is Art Deco all the way to the mauve walls and the black and white photos of movie stars on the walls. Our bathroom was large and recently renovated to included two sinks and a couple's shower. The A/C was provided by window units, which worked fine. We found the street below to be noisy on the night we were there. The breakfast was included and was served in their restaurant below. Service was very prompt and the food was good. We had a pastry basket and fresh fruit with coffee and fresh-squeezed OJ. I believe there was also cereal and yogurt, but we didn't need any. Check-in and check-out went smoothly and quickly. Overall a good hotel if you want a fabulous location and don't care about some of the amenities you can get at a larger hotel (such as room service).

Reviews.Title: “This place was great!”
Reviews.Author: verypicky57
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great little restaurant on the premesis. This worked well for a quick snack when we were exhausted from sightseeing. It also worked well for a convenient & delicious breakfast. The rooms are small, but nicely appointed. For the price I thought they were very adequate. The hotel personnel were very hospitable, and were always onpoint with recommendations for things to consider on our outings. The location of this hotel is perferct. We were close to a subway stop, across the street from Washington Square Park, and in a perfect place launch our adventures each day.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful art deco hotel”
Reviews.Author: wwotn
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in great location for eating out street markets( we stayed over weekend) next to subway plenty shops in walking distance of China Town Rooms on small side but very clean and very pleasent staff and helpful I could not get past the busy tone for airport shuttle I just left deatails as requested by receptionist and night receptionist did it all at a quieter time Taxi from JFK $50 Shuttle $19 each I wanted to buy holdall to spread weight of luggage same receptionist printed out list and prices fro K-mart only 5minutes walk away Continental breakfast included I certainly recommend this wee gem only gripe was we had room next to lift bit noisy but worth it to sllep with Clark Gable over my bed!!

Reviews.Title: “Small, small, small rooms on a beautiful Square”
Reviews.Author: Paul T
Reviews.Content: The Washington Square Hotel is in one of the most beautiful, charming locations in NYC. As a former NYU student, I used to live nearby, and this hotel is on the north west corner of the Square, in the heart of Greenwich Village. There is worldclass dining at your doorstep (Babbo), and hundreds of things to do within a few short blocks. It is also steps away from NYU, which, despite its detractors, I think is nicely integrated into Greenwich Village. As for the hotel, the rooms are seriously small, though the bathrooms are a normal size. The "interior" rooms are on an airshaft - so avoid those unless you don't mind not having any natural light. The second time we stayed there, we booked a room with a window, and had a lovely view of the Empire State Building. The room includes breakfast, but it is so crowded we normally just go to a nearby cafe. The Washington Square Hotel is not expensive by NYC standards, but you could probably find a better rate for similar quality if you search; you just won't be in Greenwich Village.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Comfy,safe, w/ Art Deco(r)!”
Reviews.Author: eyedocmike
Reviews.Content: In heart of Greenwich Village-easy access to great restaurants(we booked Babbo's across street a month in advance-every morsel worth every expensive penny!!). Our trip was my Bucket List as a jazz fan-Village Vanguard, Blue Note, Iridium-all w/in walking distance. The staff had no NY Attitude-very kind & breakfasts downstairs(North Side?) were excellent. Rooms had we wanted in great shape, clean. Very accomodating-have NO IDEA why anyone would rate this place 2 &1/2 Stars! Easily a 4+! Book it & relax folks. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in the Village”
Reviews.Author: CatskillMountainMan
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a terrific location right on Washington Square in the Village. Rooms are NYC small. I had a Deluxe Queen which was about 11'x14' and faced out onto the Square--could be noisy at times but loved having a street view onto both MacDougal and Waverly. Free continental breakfast in hotel restaurant was an added plus. I paid $275/night in peak September period when other hotels were charging in excess of $300-$400 per night for basic accomodations. So, this wasn't a bargain but was a relatively good deal for that time of year. At other times of the year, better deals and accomodations can probably be found elsewhere. Hotel is one of the few family run properties left in NYC. Good management, some friendly employees and some not but not a deal breaker. Rooms are clean and generally well maintained. This is a good choice, if you can get a room at the right price, if you want to spend time living in vibrant Manhattan neighborhood, convenient to all the city has to offer. Not luxurious, but comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Cold Rooms, Chilly Reception”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegotripper
Reviews.Content: I know everyone loves this hotel. The location is fantastic, on a street of old brownstones at the edge of the West Village. There are subways to the West Side and Downtown at the west end of the block, subways to the the East Side a couple of blocks away at Astor Place, easy taxis on Sixth Ave. Washington Square and Fifth Avenue are at the other end of the block. The price is great and the rooms are very clean and up to date. What's not to like? The heat for one thing and the front desk for another. I had a hard time feeling the warmth at this hotel. It is an old building with radiant baseboard heat below the window. There is a control to turn the heat up or down. I had two rooms during my stay. In the first room the heat worked but had a difficult time keeping up with the draft from the old air conditioner stuck in the middle of the little window. This first room was on a light well with pigeons. After my first night I asked to be moved to a room with a better view. I was given a south facing room on the same fourth floor overlooking Waverly Pl. Fair enough. There really are not any views at this hotel. I have heard that some of the rooms in the back have a view of the Empire State Building, but none of these were offered to me. The second room had bigger windows. The heat barely worked and the room was was freezing. It had the same old air conditioner stuck in the middle of the window. I also see these same dirty, old air conditioners not being able to keep the rooms cool in the summer. Another big problem with the drafty room is the window treatment. The windows have no real curtains on them, only a valence and fake drapes on the sides that do not close to cover the window completely. They rely on two sets of shades, one set filtered, one opaque. Neither covers the air conditioner and to accomplish this they use two side shades and a center shade that does not go down past the top of the air conditioner. There are big gaps between the shades letting in drafts and light. It is impossible to cover the drafty old air conditioner. The second room was so cold I couldn't shower. I was back in the first room before the day was over. In all fairness, the front desk did accommodate my room hopping without any problem, but never before or after my room changing were they very cordial. Every person who enters the hotel must go past the front desk and a "security guard." Neither ever said hello or good day. I felt like I was doing something wrong by walking through the lobby. I'm a well mannered, clean cut guy who tips and pays the bill. I deserve a hello. One day I asked the security guard for directions to Charles Street. i knew it was off of Christopher Street and i wanted directions to Christopher Street. He sent me south down Sixth Ave. to Houston Street and up the West Side Highway, a mile out of my way on a cold, windy January day. Christopher Street was one block north of Waverly up Sixth. I would have thought it a mistake on his part had he not been so adamant that I did not want to take Christopher Street, his refusal to tell me where Christopher Street was, and his insistence that I go south down Sixth no matter what. The night before I left I called the front desk to order a "taxi" to the airport for the next morning. The desk clerk said it would not be a problem. The next morning I reported to the front desk at the appointed time to find out that the "taxi" was actually an in-house car service. Without time to go looking for a real taxi, I ended up paying $15 more than I should have to get to the airport. The same security guard that gave me the bogus directions took one of my bags to the car. No tip for him. I guess the only time the Washington Square Hotel is gay and warm is on a sunny day in May.

Reviews.Title: “an oasis in greenwich village”
Reviews.Author: smacHull
Reviews.Content: my wife and I spent 5 nights at the Washington Square just before Christmas 2008. Everything about our stay was perfect, the breakfast, the staff (friendly and helpful) and the room. ok the room was fairly small as NY hotel rooms do tend to be, but it never felt really cramped, and it was very clean and well maintained during our stay.You get a safe in the room, which is great. The location is great, with most things we wanted to see within walking distance, (we are fairly fit!) and a subway station on your doorstep if you need it. If we had one complaint it was the lack of wardrobe space, in summer, no problem, in winter, nowhere to hang those big wet coats! Management note! get some coat hooks on the wall!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel. Best location”
Reviews.Author: anderson22
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights a couple of weeks before Christmas. The hotel is fantastic and we would stay here if we ever came back to NY. Great location on Washington Square and near the shops and restaurants etc of Bleeker Street. Two minute walk to the subway station. The area was far less noisy and grimy than midtown. This area seems to be a great mix of studenty and upper class. Lovely buildings and very safe streets. Great for wandering. If you like walking its really nice to take a walk up along 5th avenue, or down to Battery, and to Chinatown and Little Italy. The hotel security man Ronnie was great. If youre shopping for something in particular tell him and he will direct you to the best place. He sent us to a shopping mall in Brooklyn that was exactly what we were after.

Reviews.Title: “Cute boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: meknigh1
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was in a great location, and the staff was very friendly. The rooms were very clean, and reasonably sized (compared to other NYC hotels at this price). The continental breakfast was also a nice treat. My only complaint is that the rooms on the lower levels are very noisy at night. Request an upper level room, other wise it will be difficult to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful hotel right in the Village”
Reviews.Author: alex_bygrave
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after spending three nights uptown with friends and we were so pleased with our choice. The staff were so friendly and always happy to give directions to the Subway and tell us where we must visit. The hotel rooms were perfect, with lovely pictures of film idols from the golden age of cinema. I would definatly go to this hotel and could spend days just walking round the area, I will be going back one day!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: TataSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: Great location, near to the subway. It was my first time in New York and probably I will come back to this city and hotel again. Staff was very nice and the breakfast was very good. My husband and I had a great stay at the Washington Square Hotel. If you are looking for a good hotel, a good price and a great location then you will not go far wrong with the Washington Square.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place off the beaten tourist track”
Reviews.Author: frieda-f
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel right off Washington Square, convenient to a conference we were attending at NYU. Lots of restaurants around and it is nice to be not in the overcrowded midtown area. Our room was nice, and roomy for NYC, but there was a slight smell of old socks. It wasn't overpowering, so we just opened the window (it was nice to have windows that open). Our room was on the first floor, right on the street, so street noise was an issue. I would stay again, but would request an upper floor. Staff was very nice and the breakfast (which was included) was good.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for NYC and good location.”
Reviews.Author: LowCountryIslander
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a stop-over en route home from Europe. The location is terrific, smack in the west village, with a subway stop just at the corner that links you to just about anywhere you may need to go, including to JFK airport. The staff was very friendly, the room clean and comfortable. The breakfast in the Village North restaurant in the basement of the hotel was better then expected, fruit, coffe, juice, and pastry selection. This was my second stay and will not be my last.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: FlyingVicar
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights, found the reception staff really helpful. Room was quiet and very clean. We were at the back of the hotel on the 4th floor, building /renovation work was going on within the hotel and around but had no effect on our stay. It is close to the Metro station and grey line hop on stop. Good choice of places to eat within easy walking distance and never felt uncomfortable walking around after dark. The breakfast options included a fast self serve in the bar area with take out bags provided for a picnic, or sit down waiter service in the restaurant downstairs. Throughly recommend this hotel and will be staying here again we hope.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3* hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug90009
Reviews.Content: The WSH was a great 3* option in Greenwich village. The room we had was a good size and modern. The beds were really comfortable and we enjoyed our stay there. Check in was easy and breakfast was good too. I would def recommend if your budget cant stretch to 4-5* Midtown hotel. Also easy to get taxi outside!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in the Village”
Reviews.Author: davcat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the WSH for a week earlier this month and were very pleased. We did change rooms at the start of our stay as the Queen Deluxe we were first assigned, was very, very small! I know hotel rooms in NYC are tight and I am not hugely fussy but to be honest, I would not have been comfortable in that first room for a week (esp. after all our shopping LOL). However, a quick visit to the main desk, a new room was assigned, we just had to wait one day - so all was well. Second room wasn't huge either but was a good deal bigger than the first and was very comfortable. A little road noise can be heard, but that's shouldn't be be an issue to most visitors to NYC - I hope. The hotel is very clean, the staff courteous and helpful and the main plus - is location. I have stayed in mid town on 2 previous visits and we were ready for a change, so glad we did - it made for a completely different NY experience. There is a subway right at the end of the street and we got to all locations we wanted to without having to change trains, you get either one or the other of the 2 lines and they take you to most of the main attractions - excellent! We didn't try the restaurant - too many choices elsewhere. The complimentary breakfast is a nice touch and there was plenty of the usual continental items available. All in all, the WSH does exactly what is says on their website and I would recommend. Don't think I'll go back there though but only because I have the upper West Side in my head for next time...........................

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lilaloTLV
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel - right at the Village entrance, was simply prefect. The nearest Subway station was 2 minutes walk from it. Our room was small, especially because we took the 2 DBLB room for a family of 4, but it was OK since we used the room only for sleeping. Hotel staff were nice & helpful, and breakfast was OK but nothing to write home about. The location of this hotel is the main reason I'm sure we will return to stay in it on the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Belcasino
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at the WSH. Our main reason for picking this hotel is its location, in the heart of Greenwich Village. You're right next to the NYU campus, so of COURSE there is going to be noise and activity outside! The building only has around 9 floors, so you're not going to be high up enough to miss any noise, so if this is an issue for you, be aware. Then again, if noise is an issue, maybe New York city isn't your ideal destination?! Having said that, the noise wasn't that bad, and we managed to sleep pretty well every night (bring ear plugs!). We did ask for a quiet room, and were in room 810, which is a deluxe queen. The room was much larger than the one we stayed in last time. We had towelling robes, umbrella, hair dryer, safe, flat screen TV, iPod doc, ironing board, etc, in the room. The only problem we had was the noise from what can only be described as a construction site practically right outside our window! The building next door was being renovated and it was really bad when we first arrived, during the day. We did ask to be moved but were told our room was one of the biggest and anything else would be smaller and they couldn't move us until the next day. As it turns out, we didn't move as we were out of the hotel nearly all day and evening, and by the time we got back the construction work had stopped. Other people might experience problems with noise on this side of the building as other reviewers have mentioned it. But I don't want to sound too negative. This is a great hotel - not TOO expensive compared to other places; a bit rough around the edges in places, but you honestly can't beat the location - right in Greenwich Village, about a 10 min walk to Soho, near the subway. Plus the free breakfast isn't to be sniffed at! The staff are generally helpful, especially the great guys who work the floor in the lobby, very friendly, giving out advice and calling you a car for the airport, etc. I would definitely stay here again. Just don't expect 5* luxury and a bed turn-down service and you'll be ok!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, but small---May be noisy”
Reviews.Author: turtlez
Reviews.Content: We booked at the WSH because we felt it was a good value for Manhattan and we wanted to explore the area. Overall we enjoyed the experience....The hotel felt almost European--in fact it seemed to be full of more British folks, than Americans. We did need to carry our bags up the front steps and up one flight to our first floor room. We were there for only one night. The room size might become an issue for longer stays. The room and bathroom were small (which we knew would be the case), decor was sparse but stylish, the staff was friendly and helpful. Our major issue was with the NOISE--from the street & sidewalk just outside our window at night (the A/C is mounted in the window, so the exterior noises are not filtered out) and the construction noises in the adjacent building which is undergoing major renovation during the day. Request a "quiet" room when you book or check in. Other guests appeared to have noise problems too and they were asking to change rooms. The rooms on the front and east side of the building might be less noisy (ours was on the west side to the rear). We did not try the breakfast (included) at the hotel, choosing to walk to a nearby cafe instead. Babbo Restaurant is located across the street, if you reserve ahead and feel like splurging for a memorable dinner. Other restaurants are within walking distance. Washington Square and NYU are nearby, so lots of activity going on. Think about what you are looking for in your hotel...WSH may be great for your needs, but it does have some short-comings.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: SuzW77
Reviews.Content: Overall had an enjoyable time at the Washington Square Hotel. The room we were in was small but for all the time spent in there it wasn't really a problem. The room was clean, toiletries replaced daily, there was a safe, TV, Air Conditioning (a bit noisy). As we had an interior view room there was no problem with noise apart from the usual other inconsiderate guests who find it okay to talk at the top of their voices when they pass your room during the night, but you'll find that anywhere. The continental breakfast was good, fruit, cereal, muffins etc. The North Square restaurant is lovely and reasonably priced. I loved the Art Nouveau/Art Deco interiors, some other reviewers seemed to think it was dark but I think it was lovely and cosy. My only complaint is that I was made aware that my friend had tried to contact the hotel to put a bottle of Champagne in our room as a surprise and was passed from reception to the restaurant and back again, the outcome was we didn't get our Champagne to celebrate our honeymoon, not sure if this is symptomatic of this hotel only or more a reflection on customer services levels in NYC (which are not all they are made out to be!). The location is good if you want a break from the noise of uptown and you can spend a great afternoon exploring the village. On the whole it's not an outstanding hotel but a good experience all the same.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: beccx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the WSH at the end of August for 4 nights on a long weekend from London. Having stayed in NYC previously near Times Square we were keen to stay in a different part of the city and to explore more of Greenwich, Soho etc. The location of this hotel made it an excellent base from which to do this and is probably it's biggest asset. We arrived at night and were allocated a room on the 5th floor. We had booked a deluxe room with a queen bed and were glad we had, there wasn't much room in the bedroom so I'm not sure how much smaller the standard rooms/beds would have been. The room itself was pretty basic, clean and comfortable and it made a perfectly adequate base for our weekend stay. If you're looking for a plush room with all mod cons then this isn't the place for you but if you want somewhere clean and comfortable to lay your head at the end of a day out in NYC then this is just the place. The only real issue that we had with the room was the air-conditioning. AC is provided by small window mounted units which made a lot of noise and weren't very effective. The temperature was such that we could have done with the AC on at night but decided not to put it on as we thought it would have kept us awake with the noise. Given it's location and proximity to bars and clubs etc we did hear a bit of street noise late at night, nothing too bad but if you are a light sleeper best to ask for a quiet room if possible. Good points about the hotel are the free internet connection and complementary continental breakfast. This consists of juice, coffee or tea, cereal, yoghurt, fruit, bagel and muffin and was a good start to the day. If you want something more substantial then you can order from the menu, the prices are pretty reasonable. We also drank in the bar on the night of our arrival which was fine, if a little dark. The best thing about this place is the location. In the heart of 'the village' just across the road from Washington Square Park with a subway station at the end of the road. There are loads of bars, restaurants and shops within a 5 minute stroll and we enjoyed exploring the surrounding neighbourhoods. Overall we were happy with our stay. There was nothing fancy about this hotel but we were happy with what we got for the price we paid which we thought was very reasonable for NYC. We'd consider coming back if we wanted to stay in this part of the city again.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of history, not too much cleaning”
Reviews.Author: TravelMeansEmissions
Reviews.Content: Entering the lobby, having just enjoyed a taxi ride through the whole Greenwich Village area for the first time (so this is it! how exciting!), I was keyed up for an enjoyable stay. The reception areas are full of character—they've gone for this mix of Art Nouveau, Art Deco, combined with a Greta-Garbo vibe. Lots of dark colors, enamelling, rich velvets. Reception-area staff were also nice; courteous, helpful. But once in a guestroom (it's old Manhattan, so expect teeny-tiny and lots of rehabbing), and once your eyes get adjusted to the 1930s gloom, you begin to notice a lack of diligence in the dusting and vacuuming. Then there's the bathroom---OK, so I'm a clean freak, and if you don't mind seeing occasional hairs from other people in basins and bathtubs along with not-perfectly-removed spots from toilet bowls you'll be fine with the standard of housekeeping that the WSH is content with, at least according to the molecular evidence of the bathroom I was using. And don't look in too many corners. The breakfast room is fine (at the end of a maze of corridors; also, it turns into a gourmet lunch spot at noon). Coffee is basic (you can grab it on the run from flasks). But again, if you're sensitive to things like coffee cups and breakfast bowls that are a little sticky to the touch rather than feeling 100% clean—because they've been boiled in a dishwasher; I used to work in a canteen kichen–you might not enjoy this part of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,would definitely go again”
Reviews.Author: redforpluck
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I loved this hotel. It is a great place to return to after the hustle and bustle of the city and having visited a few other places in NY I was SO glad we were staying in 'the village'.The surrounding area has a lot of character and there are lots of quirky little shops and places to eat nearby. There was a little street noise but FAR less than you would get in other parts of New York and the hotel will give you a quiet room on request .There is a subway at the end of the street and we found it very easy to get around and it was central for all the main sights and activities.The staff couln't have ben nicer and fell over themselves to be helpful. The dining room is worth a visit , we went twice and the food was excellent each time. Yes the rooms are small but very clean and comfortable. The art deco style was cool and funky. We will certainly book here again on our next trip to NY.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Trip”
Reviews.Author: NicoofSilverlake
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Our room was quiet as it was less than 3 feet from the next building. So, nothing to look at. Room was small as is typical in NY. Bathroom quite nice. Everything new. Was a good value for the $$.
