Reviews.Title: “week stay in washington square hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christina_Uk
Reviews.Content: The hotel room we had was beautiful, recently renovated and had the amazing 1930's style that new york loves so much. the hotel itself is great, the front desk staff were not overly friendly but we didnt have any problems with them! The guy who stands in the lobby did make up for it though, he was really friendly and always had a chat when he could! The location is great for new york if you want to travel around as much as you can, located near enough inbetween Times Sq and the statue of liberty. Its also only a 10 minute walk to the subway so easy enough to get around !

Reviews.Title: “Was really really disappointed”
Reviews.Author: beckstar35
Reviews.Content: The best thing about New York is the service - but not here. I was travelling to the city for the first time and was on my own. I found the whole experience a real disappointment. You are pretty much ignored from the moment you step in till the moment you leave. No thank you after you pay. No bell boy, no assistance whatsoever provided to you once you check in. Not one member of staff smiled at me the whole time I was there. Room not available when I arrived - had to wait 5 HOURS!!!!!! even though I was told in my confirmation call made prior to arrival it would be available. Lugged bags through heavy door (with security guard just looking - too busy to open door) set off to room up wrong set of lifts, couldn't find room - was not told I should have used other lifts. Cleaning staff dont know how to clean - they didn't even wipe down basin or bath, or throw out rubbish each day. Breakfast was HORRIBLE and not even worth $1. The muffins and bagel offered were stale, and then there was some plastic fruit salad that was devoid of taste. Best thing - Babbo across the road for dinner. Stayed there for 9 nights and really was so unimpressed and so disapppointed with it. The cafe downstairs was actually shut most afternoons and I ate in the restaurant once - and was the only person in there. Had to flag down a girl to serve me - she was too busy chatting to her other wait staff, and then when the bill came they charged me for 2 extra glasses of wine - and when I questioned them didn't even get an apology. Really noisy airconditioner that intermittently switches itself off and on during the night. TV was really old and had terrible reception. My advice - pay the extra and get a better breakfast, better service and better facilities. Not worth it at all. Only good thing was the proximity to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Exception Value, Unbeatable Location”
Reviews.Author: LaMarianina
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mother on her first trip to NYC and I am happy we chose this hotel. We looked at many other properties but weighing both location and price- Washington Square was the clear choice. The staff are very considerate and take time to get to know the guests. The room was spotless and well-apointed. The bathroom was very large. There is free breakfast. What sets this hotel apart is that you get an authentic NYC experience because of the location on a quiet street in Greenwich Village- where there is hardly any car traffic. There are no chain hotels nearby so you really get the experience of living amongst the locals. Subway connections are very close and staff will arrange airport transfers. I would not hesistate to return.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved The Washington Square Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kat2882
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights at the Washington Square from July 11 to 19. We had a renovated room with 2 double beds for myself and 2 teen girls. Contrary to what we expected, we didn't find the room too small at all. After all, we didn't go to New York to stay in our room! The teens appreciated the location near NYU as it gave way to a younger crowd in the evenings. There are alot of wonderful little shops nearby and a wide variety of restaurants and bars. It is a great neighborhood to relax in after a long day of sightseeing or shopping. The subway is about a 2 minute walk from the front door of the hotel although if you are up to it, you can walk to Times Square (we did it our first night there). Staff were helpful, rooms were kept clean and the included breakfast came in handy to get us out the door and start the day as quickly as possible. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TheChezza
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, location smack bang in the middle of Greenwich Village. Small rooms which is average for NY but the beds in the deluxe rooms are mega comfortable. The conceirges are fantastic and a wealth of local knowledge. Visit the french restaurant on Bleeker called A.O.C. and sit and the bar and chew the fat with Phillip the Irish bartenders and the locals, before buying cupcakes at Amy's bakery (the queues for Magnolia are shocking!). Will def be back in 2009 and for many years to come.

Reviews.Title: “great location..”
Reviews.Author: jemimab
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for New year 2006/2007. Nice place and not too expensive as far as New York goes. Room wasnt massive and the bathroom small, but it had everything you needed. It was clean too. Liked the area, although you dont really want to be walking through the park opposite after dark. Only down side was breakfast, it wasnt that great and you had to line up every morning before you got a seat....a bit naff!! The staff were nice, although there was a bit of confusion when we booked and they nearly canceled our booking due to the fact we hadnt paid in full, even though we werent told to pay in full when we first called to book. All in all a nice stay in a fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Coudln't Have Been Nicer”
Reviews.Author: OL975
Reviews.Content: My wife, 16 year old daughter and I spent 6 wonderful days here. Before we had spent 3 nights in a 5 star midtown Manhatten hotel. Hands down we enjoyed our stay here much more. The room is comfortable, the bathroom is roomy and seems to have been newly renovated. Everything was very clean, the staff was quite friendly, the included breakfast was a nice touch. Plenty of restaurants and shops are nearby, the subway is just down the street. If we didn't know we were in New York City hotel, we would have sworn we were in a European hotel. We would and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this sweet little hotel......”
Reviews.Author: bridge35
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a beautiful little gem in the Greenwich Village area of NYC. Greenwich Village is fabulous and within walking distance to everything. I stayed here for 5 nights for a conference and was within 8-10 blocks to my destination on Broadway St. between 12th and 13th St. My initial room (#407) was in the back with a view of a construction site. I changed to room # 617 with a gorgeous view of Waverly St. The rooms are on the smaller side, but have everything you need. The bathrooms are very clean, the beds are very soft and comfortable, and if you upgrade like I did, you can have web access in your room. The staff is usually very nice and there is free breakfast in the restaurant where you can actually sit down and enjoy coffee. You can order off the menu for more. This hotel is in walking distance to NYU and Washington Square so there are many restaurants, diners, shops, 24 hr markets to get anything you will need for your hotel room. There are cabs everywhere so you can go anywhere in Manhattan. My absolute best advice from this trip is to pack very, very, very comfortable shoes as you walk everywhere. I ruined my feet from bad shoes and had to buy new ones, but the damage was done by that point. I cannot say one negative thing about this place. There is no early check in so if you arrive early, they will store your luggage for you. Every Weds. Union Square has a Green Market which is a don't miss. If you make a right out of the hotel and walk up a few blocks, there are tons of shops and beautiful restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: jwlanclos
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful little hotel! The room was quite comfortable and the service excellent. The complimentary breakfast in the dining room was really good. We thoroughly enjoyed the visit to New York--my first time. The hotel is well located near the subway, the park, and restaurants and bars and in walking distance of Chinatown and LIttle Italy. If you stay at the Washington Square, go to Volare, a great authentic Italian restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “One of our favorites in NY”
Reviews.Author: Travels_from_CT
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here for a week every June for several years, due to some work we do near NYU. It's a favorite of ours because of the small, intimate ambiance, the proximity to the park, smaller crowds than mid-town, and excellent service. If you can get rates that are reasonable by booking way ahead, it's a great value. On the downside, the rooms are NYC-small. Also, during our recent visit, the building behind the hotel was being renovated and there was a lot of construction noise at times. This looks like it could be going on for awhile. This is not the Washington Square Hotel's fault, but could be a concern if you plan on spending a lot of time in the room and are located in the back. If you stay here, be sure to walk around the block alongside the restaurant and check out the doggie day care on MacDougal St. There's a big window and you can watch all the dogs playing and waiting for their masters to arrive to take them home!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Village Location”
Reviews.Author: DrewSmith1234
Reviews.Content: The Washington Square Hotel is right in the heart of the Greenwich Village. The location gives you easy access to the village (East & West) and also the trendy Meatpacking District. Bleaker Street is around 5 minutes walk from the hotel with all its bars / cafés / restaurants and shops. The hotel itself is pretty in a boutiquey way, the hotel foyer looking like something out of the 1950’s. The room itself wasn’t spacious but there was enough room to ensure a comfortable stay (and this is New York remember!). A comfortable bed and free Wi-Fi ensured the hotel ticked the boxes. Breakfast was complimentary and plentiful, providing a nice start to the day. The Washington Square isn’t the cheapest hotel you’ll be able to find in NYC but it is towards to the lower end of the price bracket. If you want to stay in the Village rather than midtown (as we did) you’re not going to find a better place in NYC. A great hotel, friendly helpful staff and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jean marc G
Reviews.Content: We staid 9 nights in a deluxe renovated room, on the 8th level. everything was perfect. you join any undergrount line from 100 to 500m from the door. the front desk is so helpfull, all the staff is sympathetic. the breakfast, included, is simple but excellent. you can order extras for your breakfast. the restaurant and lounge bar serve excellent food also.

Reviews.Title: “I checked out the next day”
Reviews.Author: Narejos
Reviews.Content: The Washing Square - Greenwich Village. I booked 5 nights in the Washington Square Hotel. Never again. I had found a new hotel within 1 hour. We stayed the night only Hostel came to mind. I hated it - we paid 250 dollars a night - rip off. I vaule this hotel as a 90 dollar a night at the most. The rooms were not bad, clean. But the hall ways and reception left room for massive improvement. The staff didn't fill me with confidence. Breakfast - there was a big queue waiting for the next people to sit down. We wouldn't queue I'd rather pay and get seated right away so I can't comment on that. We booked in the Crabtree Metropolitain on Lexinton and got 1st class accomodation ( king room) for 9 dollars more. If you want a bigger room ask for the King. It was 15 mintuers walk to Greenwich village. Loved it. Breakfast was wonderfull. If you want to get a taxi to Greenwich Village its really cheap. Trust me, Take a cab and get a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great area, comfortable hotel, pity about the noise”
Reviews.Author: diannuccia
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the situation of this hotel which is near Greenwich Village and away from the main tourist drag. Our de luxe room was fine with two excellent double beds, plenty of storage space and a decent bathroom with good shower. Breakfast was not exciting but good enough with fruit salad, and a bread basket with bagels and muffins. Cereal was also provided on request. Fresh orange juice and coffee were very good. On our first evening we dined in the hotel restaurant which was excellent and very convenient after a long flight (we booked a table on arrival - the restaurant is usually busy). There are lots of good restaurants within 10-15 minutes walk of the hotel - it's a good idea to book, especially at the weekend. The real downside for us was the problem of noise starting with deliveries or refuse collection well before 6 am and also the very intrusive building noise which is taking place close to the hotel at the moment. This starts around 8 am and is LOUD! It was possible to reduce the noise to a small extent by keeping the window closed (but it did not appear to be double glazed - so this did not make a huge amount of difference). If the window was closed the room got warm (even in April) and the air conditioning was also extremely noisy. We are not light sleepers and can usually sleep through the sort of noise you might expect in a city , or with air conditioning, but this was really bad. Overall we liked the hotel and there is little choice in Greenwich Village area. However I think we would only book again if we were going in a cool season when it would not be necessary to use air conditioning and we would check first to see if the building work had finished. Our room was at the side of the hotel - it is just possible that rooms at the front may be quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great area”
Reviews.Author: Campster
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the WSH for 4 nights earlier this month. Found the staff to be very helpful and the rooms were small but clean. It is in a fantastic location with loads of bars/restaurants nearby and the subway a 2 min walk. Yes, the hotel was expensive and the rooms small but this is the norm for NYC! The decor in the corridors could do with some updating too. Let's face it tho, you dont come to Manhattan to sit in a hotel room - all you need is a comfortable, clean room and a decent shower which we had. The inclusive breakfast was also good (and rare for hotels in Manhattan) which set us up nicely for a hard days shopping. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: betty050408
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the WSH for 5 nights in early April. The staff were friendly, the room big with a good sized bathroom. It's an excellent base for getting all over Manhatten and over to Brooklyn (close to the A, C and E subway on West 4th). I would certainly recommend it. But make sure you pay the extra and get a Deluxe room rather than a Superior, it's certainly worth the extra.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: kristi224
Reviews.Content: We had planned to stay for 5 days but left after 2. The hotel is nicely affordable, but I guess you get what you pay for. Room was small and dank, facing a wall. There was insanely loud construction going on starting at 8 in the morning right outside our room -- did not make for a pleasant vacation experience. We found the staff to be unhelpful; for instance when we arrived no one helped us with our bags, when we discussed changing rooms we were met with indifference. This is one of the few hotels in the Village area, which is why we picked it. But overall quite a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “what a bug ridden,anti smoking rip off joint!”
Reviews.Author: OrenWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: The Washington Square hotel is an overpriced DIVE. They banned smoking in this hotel, yet the rooms are FILTHY, and the room I had had BUGS in it -- and even with the bugs and filth, they expect people to go out in the cold to smoke?! Ha!!! All the rooms I saw were the size of closets. So for a TINY, BUG INFESTED room where you are not free to smoke a cigarette, you get the honor of paying over $300.00 per night. It is a FLEA BAG HOTEL...LITERALLY. Don't stay there. (By the way, we did smoke cigarettes in their non-smoking room, in their non-smoking hotel, regardless of their new rule, which was put into place just when I made my reservation, but they didn't bother to tell me until I arrived to check in! We were too tired and cold to look for another hotel, so we checked in and smoked in the room anyway. Maybe our smoke killed some of their bug infestation problem, in that room at least)

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommandable”
Reviews.Author: travel_bee73
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the WSQ from 27/3 until 1/4 and I can recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a decent and cozy room in the middle of Manhattan. Subway station is just around the corner as well as literally hundreds of cafés, excellent restaurants, pubs, delis. We got a room at the 8th floor which was very nice and I guess considering that you were in the middle of Manhattan very quiet. There is also complimentary breakfast which we actually had only once during our stay because we are not the breakfast-type people, but it was decent - coffee, tea, fruit salad, orange juice, bagels & muffins, butter & jam. For New York and due to the excellent exchange rate (at least for people from EURO countries), this place is almost a bargain. The neighbourhood is great, we were walking around Greenwich & West Village, Soho during late night and felt absolutely safe.Would definitely go there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money in Greenwich Village at the WSH”
Reviews.Author: Durer
Reviews.Content: I always, but always, when in NYC stay at the WSH. Its strengths are its location (good for NYU and transportation), its relative cheapness (for NYC), its small scale and mainly helpful staff. The drawback is the size of the rooms. The restaurant is ok for breakfast (included is the basic but extras cost) but pricey for lunch and dinners. The jazz brunch is fun. Overall, it is recommended.

Reviews.Title: “lovey hotel in a fab area”
Reviews.Author: eleri1996
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 4 nioghts, were inroom 809 and could see the empire state building from the room which was fantastic. Breakfasts were lovely, fresh fruit, yogurt, juice. Only draw back, was no tea of coffee facilities in the room ,las as we were wking very early around 4 am to 6am would have loves a cuppa, instead it was a quick change and down to starbucks at the end of the block for a take out. Otherwise no fault as the subway wasa a block away and it was a 10 min walk to greenwich. Would ue=se the hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: chjg
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week's stay with a girlfriend - what a gem of a place, fantastic location, very clean room, friendly helpful staff, agree with all the comments made by other reviewers. Great to just walk downstairs for breakfast (ample for us, loved starting the day with healthy fruit and yogurt, orange juice, bagels, and all included in the price). Never had to queue or wait for service. We had a delux room on 2nd floor with partial view of the Square. My only criticism is that the room decor is rather drab, though had just be renovated (don't think much of their interior designer, if they had one...dull browns and beige - more colour please, but that's just my personal taste) Lovely fluffy bathrobes and lots of towels and toileries. Tip - if you can use the stairs that lead up from the restaurant to get to your room then do - much nicer and grander than the narrow cramped corridors that lead to/from the elevator (and all that horrid swirly plaster on the walls!) Location perfect - just loved Greenwich village, not at all touristy but only one stop on subway to 42nd street. Lots of great restaurants and cafes within walking distance, and felt very safe whatever the time of day. places. Staff so helpful (will book tours, recommend places to eat/visit, check flights etc - very reasurring as we were due to fly home the day after 6" snow fell and flights delayed by 6-8 hours, thankfully all back to normal the day we flew) All in all, no complaints and would definitely stay again - and happy to recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money + great location”
Reviews.Author: KatieandSimon
Reviews.Content: We arrived late into New York, so had already booked a table at The Square restaurant, right next door to the Washington Square Hotel, and as we found out, part of the hotel itself. The food was gorgeous and it was great to stumble back next door to our lovely clean and soft, comfy bed to sleep off the jet lag. Having read other reviews about noisy rooms, we had requested a room far away from the elevator. The room we got had no view (we didnt need one!) but was so quiet, we didnt hear anything! Next morning the fresh complimentary breakfast was served in the restaurant we had been to the night before! The staff were friendly and smiley without being gushing. The location of the hotel was perfect for us - metro station right on the corner, and on Saturday night Greenwich Village was right on the doorstep - really busy nightlife with a great atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Trying to put a good face on it”
Reviews.Author: Cynical77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Washington Square Hotel on Feb. 12, 2008. I chose it for its proximity to NYU law school (block and a half away). I paid $220 + taxes, which included breakfast. The hotel did the best it could in an old building. My room was small, just big enough for a double bed with 3-4' of space on three sides. The bathroom was small enough that when I put the bathmat on the floor, it was like wall-to-wall carpeting. But the room and bathroom were both very clean, and I heard no street noise. (I was in room 329, and the window faced a courtyard or alley, I couldn't tell which.) I heard the shower in the room above me once, but otherwise did not hear any noise from nearby rooms. The room was very thoughtfully outfitted. The bed was comfortable and clean, there was free (wired and wireless) internet access, bathrobes, an umbrella (which I needed), etc. The fitness room was also small, but had a couple of treadmills, a stepper, half a dozen weight machines, and a few other things. The hotel doesn't have room service, but there is a nice restaurant on the first level and it will package food to go so you can take it back to your room. I had some terrific scallops there. In the morning, breakfast is served there -- fresh squeezed orange juice, coffee, fruit salad, bagels and muffins are brought to your table and included in your room rate, and then you can also add additional food (one egg, $2, three-egg omelette, $9). I'd probably return to this hotel if I needed to stay by NYU again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: I_MLeicester
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel in Greenwich Village. Reasonably priced (for New York), good location, very good breakfast included in the room fee. Only complaint was getting a room next to the lift but at least that wasn't working between midnight and 7am.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location!!”
Reviews.Author: littlep75
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights over New Years 2007-08 and had a great stay. I was in one of the room son the third floor which has been refurbished and feel a good job has been done on the refurb. The room actually felt quite spacious, with a large bed and smaller separate bathroom. The room looked exactly like the hotel photos that you can see. The location is fantastic - Washington Square across the road, an entrance to the W4th St subway station at the other end of the block and only a couple of blocks to walk to Bleeker Street. The staff were very helpful both in just checking in and out as well as with any questions that I had. The included breakfast at the restaurant was a great way to get the day started, with usually juice/coffee, a bowl of fruit salad and a plate of breads/muffins. All in all, would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, mixed stay...”
Reviews.Author: JimBobOxford
Reviews.Content: First - the location is great. If you want a more authentic New York experience, Greenwich Village is a must. Great atmosphere, shops, coffee shops (real, not just Starbucks!), and the hotel is bang in the middle of all of these. A subway just around the corner will wizz you up to Times Square, but we couldn't wait to get back again! Having stayed in New York before, there are some things you just can't change... yes the rooms aren't huge, but who needs a huge room when there's so much to see outside! The bigger issue was the size of the bed, which though it said Queen, was not the size I expected, and my feet did go over the end! Yes, it was noisy outside, and we did have to move once to escape the noise from above the bar exit at 2am, and yes the lorries and sirens woke us up, but this is a city, so you get over it! The staff were helpful and generally very friendly, and the breakfasts were great. We did eat in the bar on our first night, and the food and service were very good. Would I go back? I think so, and I would recommend to friends, but for a real authentic experience in a great location, you have to put up with the odd flaw!

Reviews.Title: “Well Priced, Great location, No Troubles!”
Reviews.Author: markelliot
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a word fantastic and made our holiday. From the moment of arrival we where welcomed by a cheery chap who opened the door and gave us a happy holidays shout! The room was not huge by any means but it was clean tidy and compact. It wasn't too small though dont think that... It depends I guess on what you are looking for. I loved the touch of having bath robes for each of us and an umbarella for our use during our stay. We arrived also to find that brekfast was included with our room rate... which was a welcome surprise as when we booked with expedia we understood it was not. The breakfasts where of a continental style served by proffessional team of hispanic waitors all dressed in black. They just hit the spot with me and I have no complaints. They also offered huge cooked breakfast options and we watched many people getting platefulls delivered whilst thinking how could they possibly down all that food at this time in the morning. As for the general hotel stuff.. It was busy but not to noisy... the air conditioning worked fine... we had no problems with the bathroom or a supply of hot water... In short a well recomended hotel... especially if you preffer the downtown area of the city. Much less bussier than the whole mid town razamataz... which is nice to experiance but not great to come home to in my oppinion.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: TrishFish26
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel through Trailfinders as it is one of their recommended hotels. Although you see the rooms quoted as being small, ours was plenty big enough (although we did book a deluxe room). Lovely bathroom with 'condiments' amply provided. We were expecting a mediocre breakfast as it was included, but were pleasantly surprised. We had an evening meal in the North Square restaurant which was delicious. Not too far to walk to a choice of metro stations - and an easy walk to the shopping area of Greenwich Village. The Olive Tree is a short walk and also a nice place to eat and while-away an evening. We'd book again.

Reviews.Title: “Very cozy hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ihopeyoudancer
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the Washington Square Hotel and had a wonderful experience. Because we were a family of four on a budget we were able to book a renovated quad room which provided ample space and a very nice, clean bathroom. The staff including the breakfast crew were always smiling and very helpful and made us feel welcome in a big, busy city. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: JREDartford_Kent_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in mid December. The room and bathroom were clean and reasonably sized. The room was warm (NYC had two snowstorms whilst we were there). No view from the room but we hadn't come to NY to sit in a hotel room. Reception staff were always helpful, provided maps, discount vouchers and advice. They even booked us in on our return flights and printed our boarding cards for us. The included breakfast was a pleasant surprise, fresh fruit and juice followed by muffins, scones and bagels, unlimited tea or coffee. The North Square restaurant was good value for evening meals - but book if you intend to dine there on Friday or Saturday night as it is very popular. The subway at West 4th Street is just a block away. All in all an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: RAGAZZA
Reviews.Content: I just come back from NY were I stayed at the WSH and it was great : the staff very nice and usufull, the hotel is confortable and very well located with a lot restaurants and jazz bars at walk distance, I'll definitly stay there again next time I'll be in NY

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UkBritAbroad
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a real gem in New York City. I had read in earlier reviews that the rooms were small but found them to be comfortable and perfectly adequate (after all who wants to spend much time in their room in New York City!) The staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel was situated in a quiet area in Greenwich Village directly across from Washington Square Park, a hangout for the many students around the area. The subway and a drug store were just around the corner (provisions of water etc. and transport links) and there were always plenty of cabs passing by. Complimentary breakfast was included in the room price but extra items e.g. omelette, pancakes etc. could be ordered for a few dollars extra. Restaurant was very popular with the locals (which is always a good sign) and the food was excellent at lunchtime and in the evenings. There is even a lounge bar menu if you are feeling like a snack (great food again). Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Valleytravels11
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in lovely, quiet area yet only one block from major subway station. You are also near 24 hour drugstore, coffee, restaurants and bus lines. Cabs run down street often. Our room was fairly large, by NY standards, and comfortable. It was a little dark, no view, but that's OK if it's quiet. Our main complaint is tiny one -- the (free) breakfast area was so tight that you felt overwhelmed if a loud,annoying person happened to be braying at the next table. We plan to come back to NY and stay here again, no question.

Reviews.Title: “A great find in the Village!”
Reviews.Author: CurlyGirl_Ohio
Reviews.Content: I had a difficult task ahead in booking a hotel for Marathon weekend. Everything seemed to be booked or more than $400/night. (I know Manhattan hotels are expensive, but sheesh!) I looked into bed & breakfast places but my two-night stay was shy of the minimum for those few places that had rooms left. Since the rate I received for a single was so far below the rates I found for other hotels, I was nervous about the stay. But I have to say, the hotel far exceeded my expectations. I was allowed to check in very early by a pleasant front desk attendant. I found my (remodeled) room on the second floor to be lovely, but small, which is typical of New York, but with plenty of storage and surface space for my needs. My window overlooked an airshaft. Some people might not like that they can't look out on the city, but I prefer a quiet room at night and that's exactly what I got. Plus the room/bathroom were immaculate. (I even pulled up the sheets and examined the mattress corners for my bedbug check ;-) The continental breakfast was surprisingly satisfying (fruit, bread basket, coffee, juice) but I must say the service was spotty. Day one we couldn't get anyone's attention and sat for quite a while before being served. Second day there were several pleasant servers fawning. Who knows? I had a problem w/the heat in my room--too much of it---and the front desk had someone from maintenance up there within 5 minutes to turn off the register for me. In fact, I found the front desk to be extremely helpful, in general--one arranged very affordable, last-minute car service for our group, and someone was always willing to give directions, etc. (Loved that the subway entrance was a short block away and there was a drugstore on the corner.) All in all, I would definitely stay there again and recommend them wholeheartedly. (Note, I'm rating them a 5 because the hotel is a tremendous value for the price, not that they are on par with a 5 star hotel in Manhattan.)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, try to stay on upper floors....”
Reviews.Author: sarahandpaul99
Reviews.Content: What a great location, stayed off Times Sq last time in New York and Greenwich is so much better. Staff were friendly (with the exception of the Breakfast staff) and we had no problems changing the room after a disastrous first night. We stayed for 4 nights. The first night we stayed in Rm 209 which I would avoid unless you intend being awake by 6am due to the laundry noise from downstairs and the building site next door. We were moved to the top floor for the next three nights and it was plain sailing from there. Rooms are small but clean, but when in NYC you shouldn't be in any hotel room for longer than it takes to get a good nights sleep. Less then a block from the Subway and within 2 minutes walk of some great bars and restaurants. Try Galanga for the best Thai food outside of Thailand and go to Grooves when Li'nard and his band are playing. Washington Sq Hotel was a great base for exploring NYC and the area around it was far better than being in the overcrowded uptown area.

Reviews.Title: “A little find”
Reviews.Author: TheSte8
Reviews.Content: Walsall, West Mids-11th October 2007. We stayed here for 5 nights, our first time in NYC, we would really recommend this hotel for lots of reasons:- Located in Greenwich Village giving easy access to downtown & midtown Manhattan. Staff are very helpful, willing to book excursions and cars. Doormen very ammenable, giving advice on the local area and hailing cabs.Our room was not ready on arrival but we were immediately offered complimentary cocktails in the bar to pass the time. Hotel is not huge but has been re-furbished, complimentary breakfast is a good start to the day, we ate in the hotel several times and food was a very good standard at a reasonable cost. Our room was compact and although kitted out with all the 'little extras', bath robes, shower gels etc, was classed as an 'internal room' and did not have any natural light. In fairness we knew that when we booked it, but in hindsight had it been available when we booked we would have paid the little extra for an external facing room. The hotel is situated on the corner overlooking Washington Square Park, there always seemed to be some type of entertainment going on there eg, musicians & singers. There are a lot of cafes and bars within easy walking distance, tables & chairs on the pavements with a relaxed European style atmosphere. Can recommend the open top bus tours (particularly the night time tour which takes you over into Brooklyn giving unforgettable views of the Manhattan skyline at night). Also the evening sunset water taxi harbour cruise was excellent value for money with more stunning views. On our final evening we 'treated' ourselves to a meal at Gordon Ramsey's restaurant at The London Hotel and we were not disappointed, a real gastronomic experience. Our taste buds are spoilt forever. If you want to stay somewhere with easy access to all of Manhattan and like the idea of the 'village' atmosphere we can really recommend this hotel, a haven after the hustle & bustle of Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Zelda_T
Reviews.Content: Manhattan is a very expensive place to stay so relatively speaking, the Washington Square hotel is a 'bargain' - even though 4 nights there cost over £500! The location can't be beaten - right opposite Washington Square which is a great, safe place to hang out at weekends listening to the buskers. There's also a subway station literally two minutes away and a 24 hour drug store. The staff are really friendly and helpful and the door staff can give you great tips for places to eat. The free breakfast of a toasted bagel and fresh fruit is also great for those days when you've had your fill of American sized breakfasts! The rooms are small by American standards but we had no complaints - who goes to New York to stay in their hotel room anyway? I will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nice hotel and the best location”
Reviews.Author: Jessib
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel mostly because i wanted to live in that area and there are not so many hotels there, atleast not with good rewiews. I took a single normal room and it was good. A little bit small but who cares. It was clean with a nice bathroom and TV. Breakfast was great in the lovely restaurant and the staff was very welcoming. Next time i come to New york i will defenetly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bluespix77
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel mostly because of the location and we were a little nervous because of certain reviews on this site. We did take the advice in other reviews and booked a Delux room. We were not at all disapointed. The staff were very friendly, always greeting us and offering help and assistance whenever we needed it. The rooms we did not consider small, they were spotless and modern. Complimentary smellies, good quality towels and lovely robes. The complimentary breakfast (given that most hotels these days are room only) was excellent, fresh fruit salad, lovely muffin/bagel basket, endless fresh coffee and endless freshly squeezed orange juice. And fortunately we never had to que on the stairs to get a table. The location is what originally sold us on this hotel and it was perfect, in the middle of Greenwich Village, so we were surronded by nice bars and restaurants - try the olive tree on nearby MacDougal Street and within walking distance of the shopping delights of Soho! The subway is a 1 minute walk away. I will certainly be reccomending the Washington Square Hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: ukbkd
Reviews.Content: We were expecting a small room and we got one. However, it was very functional, had everything we wanted, including a hair dryer, TV, iron and ironing board. The room was very clean, with good quality towels, changed daily and complimentary tolietries. The hotel is in an excellent location with a subway station just 200 yards away and many good bars and restaurants nearby. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful, despite what some other reports have stated. One downside was the complimentary breakfast. No matter what time we went for breakfast, we had to queue on the stairs while we waited for someone to come and show us to a table. Then when we finally got a table, the service was slow and somewhat lacking. The one day we decided to order something cooked, at an additional charge, they got the order wrong. After that we decided to eat breakfast outside at one of the many good and inexpensive diners in the area. We visited the hotel bar once, but almost $18 for two beers was a little excessive, so we didn't go there again. At the end of the day, the hotel was excellent value for money, although the bar wasn't and the breakfast problems would not stop us staying there again. Most hotels are room only, so treat this one as such and you can't go far wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant enough hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mingymoo
Reviews.Content: I agree with OKCowgirl on most of the points. Further: 1) Ask for a room facing MacDougall St. I was on the 2nd floor in a deluxe room and heard absolutely nothing. 2) The bed and pillows in the deluxe room were great. 3) I thought the breakfast was fine. I was surprised to have a bowl of fresh fruit. The bagels and muffin were soft. 4) Turn right onto Waverly Place and there is a Duane Reade 24hr pharmacy. Note the subway station next door.

Reviews.Title: “O.K. place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RootboySlim
Reviews.Content: O.K. Hotel. Lobby nice. We stayed on the third floor. The room was smallish with a queen bed. Clean, no mold in the bathroom grout, but make no mistake this ain't the Ritz (also not the Ritz price!) This room was very European (read small room area, small bathroom, one chair at the dresser) The bed was comfortable, clean and the A/C good (but a bit on the noisy side). The T.V was mounted high on the wall...I felt like I needed to look for a place to insert quarters to operate it...... It's away from the street so there is no outside noise.; However, one of the doors in the immediate vicinity needed its damper replaced, because we could occasionally hear it slam, even with the A/C running. The hallways are very English, small and winding (no big deal, but you can get turned around if you are not paying attention) My biggest gripe is that the hallway smelled like a locker room and if you have a very sensitive sniffer one can faintly smell it in the room. The hallway was not air conditioned and was hot and stuffy. The hallway on the third floor looked like it was in the middle of a renovation as the white plaster "swirling" on the walls was worked around some old existing wall tile decoration lending a "cheap hotel" feel. The attached restaurant was excellent for dinner and reasonably priced, but the "free" continental breakfast was disappointing; The staff seemed in a hurry and not very attentive. I believe it is a different lease operation from the dinner business as it had a different feel, different staff and no one was proficient at speaking English. "Dittos" with the other reviewers regarding the convenience of the location. Overall a nice inexpensive (for NYC) hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: AJMBournemouth
Reviews.Content: I` ve stayed before & like the location & price. This time the room was gloomy and the air con so loud. The breakfast staff were just awful. Not a smile or thank you between them all. We ate breakfast elsewhee after the second day. But it was booked for it`s location and because it was suppose to have Art Deco features (not fab) - you get what you pay for, however we wil probably go elsewhere next time we visit NY.

Reviews.Title: “A Plus from our whole group”
Reviews.Author: blackdress
Reviews.Content: We also have a glowing review for this hotel. We had 4 women stay in one room. Got the deluxe (over the superior) and had ample room for four sets of luggage plus all the shopping purchases. We had a corner room, 221, that had a view of the square and windows on two sides. Our bathroom was roomy and had two sinks. The room had two double beds, a long table vanity, one sitting chair, chest of drawers, and a 3 nighttables, everyone had their own space. The beds in the deluxe room were dreamy, soft top mattress with fluffy white comforters. The a/c was one wall unit but monitored itself on and off and seemed to keep up fine in July weather. Very convenient to subways and restaurants. The staff was friendly, and helpful, from front desk to security and doormen. It was nice staying on the 2nd floor because we could take the one flight of stairs instead of waiting on a somewhat slow elevator. It is a quiet neighborhood so being on a lower floor didn't matter.

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Copyboy
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel for $235/night in such an expensive city. We arrived early, they stored our bags no problem and based upon recommendations here we requested a deluxe room on an upper floor. Upon our return, we were given exactly that on that on the top floor. It was plenty spacious, super clean, had a nice bathroom, windows on either side of the room, one with a view of the park. The room had been recently renovated and looked just like the picture on their website. We were right next to the elevator but never heard it. The AC, a window unit, was new, worked fine and wasn’t particularly noisy. We didn’t visit the bar, but did enjoy the nice complimentary continental breakfast of fresh fruit, juice, coffee, muffins and bagels (yes, no cream cheese) in the pleasant restaurant. Everyone, even the night staff, were very nice, especially the woman who checked us in and was so accommodating of our specific room request. We noticed people working there on continued improvements to the property (though that didn’t at all take away from our visit). The location was perfect for us being so near the neighborhoods we were most interested in. The subway was less than a block away giving quick, easy, no-transfer service to the heart of Midtown. I highly recommend this hotel. Thank you to all the members who wrote reviews and helped us make choices that made for such a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: joantampa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at WSH for eight nights. My room was very nice, not tiny, and had two windows with a partial view of the park. I thought the staff was generally helpful and friendly, some more than others, but none were even close to what I would consider rude. The free breakfast was great. The meals I had in the dining room were very good, the wine list was interesting, and the prices were not unreasonable. The location is great. I would not hesitate to stay there again or to recommend it to a friend. I think the key is to understand that you are not staying in a resort, and if you care about room size or view, ask for a room that fits your expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Jazzman1963
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a long weekend trip in NYC and the Washington Square Hotel was a wonderful experience. From the staff to the room and to the friendly and always helpful lobby security I would not hesitate to stay here in the future. After reading several negative reviews we was frankly a bit skeptical, but after arriving our doubts were set at ease. The rooms are plenty big enough...the most pleasanr surprise afeter reading how small the rooms were. We have stayed at a boutigue hotel in London UK in the past and the rooms there were much smaler than the WSH. Being in the village and close to NYU, Little Italy, Chinatown, and the subway stations at either W 4th St or Union Square is also a plus. You can also walk 2 blocks west on W 4th st to Joe's Coffee house for some of the best cappucino and pastries in NYC. Overall a very pleasant stay in a quaint and quiet hotel....my hat's off to all the staff at the Washington Sq Hotel for making our stay enjoyable

Reviews.Title: “overall great experience”
Reviews.Author: travel241
Reviews.Content: To anyone who has never stayed in New York city please be advised hotel Rooms are small unless you are staying in a 5 star paying the big bucks!! However if you are looking for clean and good value for your money than the Washington Square hotel maybe for you. This hotel is not in the tourist area ie: Times Square , Broadway. You would not find a hotel in that area as nice for the price. This hotel is in a great location if you are interested in staying in Greenwich Village and would like to be near Soho , Little Italy, China town , Canal street and more. There are great patios where you will be sitting with locals where the food is good and much better priced. The subway is around the corner and there is always a cab. We stayed for 3 nights and will not hesitate to go back. 1. The room was clean ,and updated, the washroom had everything you needed it to ..plenty of clean towels ,hair dryer ..shampoos and soaps. 2. I read where people complained about the rude staff...well we were there long enough to see different staff members with shift changes and they were all friendly and were helpful with any questions or requests we had. 3. The contintental breakfast was nice as well , we were seated and asked if we would like coffee or tea, than brought a selection of toasted bagels , muffins and bowl of fresh fruit with orange juice. I have always read reviews on here and have taken them with a grain of salt and I suggest you do the same. I have tried to be as honest as I can with this review. I am well travelled and have stayed in many hotels all over the world. Hope this helps, Mary

Reviews.Title: “Nice breakfast and good location, but poor rooms and rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Aloisie
Reviews.Content: I will give WSH its due--the breakfast was great and the security man was excellent--friendly and attentive. After that and the location, not much I can say to recommend this hotel. I booked and confirmed (two days prior) a room with one queen-sized bed. When I checked in and went to the room, it had two double beds. I went back to the front desk and the clerk told me that they were queen beds, which obviously was not true. Then they tried to appease me and told me that this room with two double beds was an "upgrade" that I should be happy. I told them that since we were planning to only sleep in one bed, this was actually a downgrade for me. In response to my concerns, another staff member literally said to me that there were "plenty of hotels in NY" and to go find another one! When I asked why my confirmed room was not available, the manager said that they allow people to stay in their rooms if they decide to extend their time at the hotel. I can't imagine a hotel adopting this policy as this could confuse all the reservations that were made. In my experience, if I want to extend my stay at other hotels and the room is not available, I have to either leave or change rooms. Hard to believe that this really isn't their policy. OK--enough about the staff, let's focus on the rooms. The beds are not comfortable and the rooms are basic, to say the least. However, I could put up with this if the staff hadn't been so rude. As I said, I couldn't recommend this hotel unless there wasn't much left in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Joelly
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the WSH and the staff could not be more friendly and helpful. The standard rooms are small, but recently refurbished and clean with comfortable beds. Many do not have external views. Do not stay here if you want a hotel with guaranteed quiet room and great views. The best feature is the location which is right on the Park. You can walk in any direction from here and find fantastic restaurants, cafes, clubs and bars. Music is everywhere, jazz in the streets, blues in the Park, opera in the restaurant along the road. The famous people to have stayed here in the 60's when it was a residential hotel include Bob Dylan with Joan Baez, Barbara Streisand & many others. Good complimentary breakfast served until 11 am. Highly recommended, but remember to pack your earplugs for a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Not for me”
Reviews.Author: michellelynn
Reviews.Content: The location is great, as is the pricing. After that, there's not much to recommend the property. The rooms were small, but I expected it would be so for the price. I was trying to view it as a edgy, village experience, but mostly it felt dingy and not clean (dirty would be overstating it). The room color was drab, the window AC unit noisy and inefficient. The single elevator carried the trash and the guests. You get the idea. When I strategize how to get into and out of the shower without bare feet, it's not a place where I'll return.

Reviews.Title: “great location, unwelcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: francesca104
Reviews.Content: You couldn't beat the location -- quiet street right in the Village. No other area we'd rather be in. As previously mentioned though, rooms were tiny. We stayed for a week (Christmas time) - first room we were given had no windows and no space to move around. Felt claustrophobic so we moved to a larger room with 2 windows. Much better... Front desk people just had no interest in making us feel we were welcome. They would just chat with each other mostly. Still we weren't there for the hotel and it was a great holiday watching jazz, eating great food, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Hated this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jalib
Reviews.Content: We have one more day to stay at this hotel and we are counting the hours. It's not just that the room is tiny, we can't understand how they can expect twopeople to stay here for 3 nights in a room with three drawers only. There's a card chair to sit in but it's also being used currently to hang our jackets. The closet is small as well. The staff is perfuntory and rather inattentive with exception of a security man in lobby. He seems to double as a bell boy but a bell boy who only shows you where the elevator is and then you're on your own! i'd rather stay at a Motel 6. The front desk people seem inept. We booked a limo one evening for a Saturday. The next morning there was no record of this reservation. I asked for a sewing kit and was told by woman clerk to go to the drugstore. Another clerk overheard her and pulled a sewing kit out of a drawer filled with them. Poor training here. The bed is so short that it didn't accommodate my 5'6" frame.Lots of construction going on here also so 7AM was the latest we could sleep here. Pluses: The comp continental breakfast was a plus as well as the location across from the park. But we would never, ever stay in this so-called deluxe Queen room again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here time and time again”
Reviews.Author: Matt992264OP
Reviews.Content: No hesitation in recommending this hotel. Have stayed here on numerous occasions and if anything, this lovely hotel just gets better and better. Good location, excellent attentive staff and very comfortable rooms - reasonably priced too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, characterful hotel”
Reviews.Author: easternrose
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the WSH in mid-February 2007 and really enjoyed our stay there. The location is brilliant - really near to loads of great cafes, restaurants and shops - and has much more character than the rather soulless hotels in midtown. We booked a deluxe room which had obviously been fairly recently refurbished in an art deco style and which was a reasonable size. It also came with a view of the Park and of Babbo's across the road! My only niggle with the room was that the radiator was tiny and it was a little cold. We did manage however to obtain extra blankets. The bar staff were very sweet - we hadn't tried bourbon before so the barman let us try a sample of the most popular for free and suggested that we might like also to try a Manhattan. Other staff were friendly enough - we like to keep ourselves to ourselves so don't like over intrusive staff. Breakfast was included in the price and was fruit salad plus a basket of toasted bagels and muffins. All in all a great stay and I would highly recommend the hotel and the area.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: CaryAllison
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights. I was attending a conference at NYU and my wife was doing art business. We travel to New York a lot. My wife is an artist and her gallery representation is in Chelsea, and her father, a New York City native, lives in midtown. We spend almost all of our time downtown and are constantly looking for good places to stay in the Village, SoHo, or Chelsea, and thought we would give this one a try, given my business at NYU. I have to say that this was my favorite place to stay downtown so far, for the money (I think we ended paying about 250 a night--it would be more between Labor Day and New Year's, I imagine. But you can spend that much in NYC and end up in a dump, and as we all know, star ratings for NYC hotels mean nothing--you have to know the place). To begin with, the location is fantastic, with easy walking distance to some of the best streets and shops in the city (Bleecker St.., for example, with the fabulous Murray's Cheese Shop and Amy's Breads, is only a few blocks away). Good subway access nearby as well, and right off Broadway. We often stay at the Solita SoHo hotel, at Grand St. and Lafayette (about a 15-20 minute walk down Broadway), and found this hotel better for the same money. To begin with, our room was very large by New York standards--much larger than the Solita--had a very nice bathroom with good light, and included free internet access. The furnishings, linens, etc. were relatively new and in excellent condition, and the decor was tasteful and Deco-flavored. The building has a lot of character and charm and has the feel of "old New York," as that part of the city does. And by "charm" I don't mean "old and broken down." Quite the contrary, the building is in excellent shape, with a nice, spacious lobby, very good elevator, a nice, cozy little bar right off the lobby, and a good bar and restaurant (the North Square) attached, where a nice continental breakfast was included in the rate (an excellent muffin, fresh fruit, and coffee and juice--not a big deal when you're surrounded by great coffee shops, but nice nonetheless). We found the service to be fine, though as with most New York hotels, it depends a bit on who is working the desk and whether you run into any serious problems, which we did not. We found the staff friendly, helpful, and warm. In short, if you want to stay in the Village, and you don't want to stay (or pay) in a larger place like one of the Grands downtown, this is an excellent choice, with a very good combination of character, service, and amenities. And the location is as good as it gets. This is where we'll stay from now on when we visit NYC, and that's quite a compliment, given how often we go there.

Reviews.Title: “great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sputwesthampstead
Reviews.Content: I was recommended to stay at this hotel by one of my mates in London. This hotel is great, nice and cosy and very relaxed. The staff are all really friendly and really liked the Ambience. For the price and the location of this hotel you cannot beat it! Make sure you book a deluxe room as the others are not so cool. I have been back several times now and always stay at the Washington Square which I find is one of the best hotels I have stayed in for location and value for money. ANYONE FROM THE UK STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Great Village location, character and price!”
Reviews.Author: Toronto_trekker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights, the Thursday and Friday of Easter weekend 2007. We arrived in the morning and check-in is not until 3 p.m., so we arranged with the doorman to store our luggage and come back later, which was no problem. The front desk noted our request to have a room on a higher floor, and this was the case when we returned. Everyone we dealt with was very helpful and pleasant. Our room was quite comfortable and very clean. There was some noise from the street the first night, but it did not last long. We faced onto McDougall with a view of the park; I can imagine there would be more street noise in the summer. Our room was right behind the elevator, but we did not hear it at all. The hallways are somewhat narrow but appear to have been painted and carpeted in the last few years. Judging by the decor of our room, we may have had a superior room rather than the deluxe room we booked; if so I would recommend the superior as some other reviewers have. It was not overly large but fine for two people. The hotel is central to everything we wanted, including several subway lines. We had breakfast in the restaurant both mornings. The food and service is good, though a bit expensive. We ordered from the menu instead of having the included breakfast (which is coffee, fresh-squeezed orange juice, a dish of fruit salad and a basket of toasted bagels with jam and butter). There are many choices in the area, and we will probably try other cafes or restaurants next time. We did not have lunch or dinner in the hotel, nor did we try the bar. The doorman on the Thursday was very friendly and recommended various places to see and things to do. And the doorman on Saturday actually ran down the street to catch up with us & let us know that the front desk had discovered they had charged the wrong credit card (I had changed from the card I used to make the booking, but they put the charge through on the original card & I did not notice). This was corrected with profuse apologies. Again, our flight was well after check-out time, but leaving our bags was no problem, so we were able to enjoy the rest of the afternoon. Even the maintenance guy that took our bags was friendly and chatty. There may be some staff at this hotel that are not welcoming, but we did not meet any, of the eight or nine that I can recall. We did a lot of online research before deciding on this hotel, and for the price I think this is one of the best choices. The location is unbeatable, the hotel has so much character compared to a chain hotel, and in New York you can easily pay double for the same size room elsewhere. Our experience was good, and we spoke with several guests who were repeat visitors because they liked the hotel and the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Locatation, Great Interior...”
Reviews.Author: Sausages1
Reviews.Content: Whilst this hotel is in a fantastic location and is generally a great place to stay, I did find some of the front desk staff rather sullen and unwelcoming. Only 2 of the 6 or so staff were actually friendly. Make sure you book a deluxe room with a view otherwise you'll end up with a brick wall outside your window making the room very hot and the noise of the ac unit unbearable. Other than that....highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: LA310
Reviews.Content: Half the price of other NYC hotels if you book ahead of time, right in the middle of cultural and interesting things to do and see, no frills hotel, impeccably clean, spotless bathroom and linen, safe, friendly enough as I don't aim to befriend the staff, 6$ cab ride from Javits, 7$ from madison area, same for trendy tribeka shopping, diners, shops, street vendors... and right across the street from washington square. only complaint: horrible pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: JenC-7
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a fantastic location right in the middle of Greenwich Village... The staff was nice, the bar was cool, and the hotel was walking distance of great nightlife and restaurants. You definitely are paying for location, the room was tiny (but clean) and non-descript...

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, good value”
Reviews.Author: diem_perdidi
Reviews.Content: Room was a bit shabby but very clean and the bathroom was immaculate. The location was brilliant, walking distance to most sights in the village. Although the room temperature was fine, the lobby and hallways were overheated to the point of being unbearable. The hotel can be very noisy, and various slamming doors and guests running up and down the hallway shouting can be heard quite loudly in the room (especially at 3 am). I did have one issue with the front desk. My flight was delayed by several hours because of weather and I had called to arrange with the front desk to have a friend who was meeting me allowed to check into the room before my arrival. They assured me that this was no problem, however, when she arrived they would not allow her to check in because she didn't have a credit card and suggested that she sit in the lobby and wait for me (for 6 hours). It took several more calls to sort this out and they finally let her into the room about an hour or 2 before I arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel - but don't drink here!”
Reviews.Author: devonburd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the WSH for 5 nights in mid Feb. The room was great - although there was something mad going on with the heating in the bathroom and the room was like 1000 degrees, even with the aircon on!! (slightly odd in the middle of a snow storm, but reception weren't bothered about wasting energy) The location of this hotel is great - right in the village. So much nicer down here than up in dull midtown. Great restaurants and bars are on the doorstep - which is a very good thing, as we found that the bar staff in both the cafe on the first floor and downstairs bar were APPALLING!! (Except one girl who ran the cafe on a Thursday evening - she was friendly and helpful!). The staff NEVER smile and frequently ignore guests and walk away from them while taking their order. This is likely to be due to the fact that service is automatically added on to the check here - so make a stand if you don't feel like paying the service!! I would go back to WSH - I just won't have a drink there!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JaneYost
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little hotel....great location, right on Washington Square, 2 blocks from the heart of West Village, same street as the most historic residential real estate left in Manhattan today, walking distance from Soho. Gorgeous foyer, staff is what you'd expect in most NYC hotels, efficient within their capabilities, rooms are modest and quite small, but adequate. Not adequate for a long stay with lots of shopping however! I've stayed there twice, once with company, and another time on my own, in a single bed room. That room was a little sparse i must say, but it suited my purpose at the time, and it was available. Nice little restaurant in the basement. If you sit over by the street window, you could have a direct view across to Washington Square Park and watch life go by while having a sumptuous breakfast (which if i remember correctly was one of the best i've had). Just a few steps away from 6th Ave and a fast taxi ride uptown.

Reviews.Title: “Location great; service appalling”
Reviews.Author: snsf
Reviews.Content: Our maid was wonderfully welcoming, and most of the security guards were friendly enough; but the reception and wait staff made our experience at the WSH less than acceptable. By the end of our 11 night stay, we felt that: - every time we entered the lobby we were aliens and not paying guests (but for two security guards who greeted all visitors warmly, the security and reception personnel all stared and eyeballed); - the reception staff were gruff; - wait staff serving continental breakfast (included in room price) had their minds on anything but service, treating guests like cattle; and - included breakfast is adequate, but unsatisfying and predictable after a couple of sittings. The location is, however, outstanding; and the property seems well maintained. Rooms are small but functional and accord with the price.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in the village”
Reviews.Author: dublinminx
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to the WSH and I was very happy again with my choice. I would always book a deluxe room, they are far nicer than the regular rooms. The location is prime for me. This time I feel like I had a slightly larger room, with a fabulous view of the park. The rooms though small, are spotless. Staff very helpful, and the location is not to be beaten. I will return

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: jaesea
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights at the end of January 2007 and found this property to be delightful. After reading through most of the reviews here, I followed one travellers advice and when I booked, I requested a Deluxe room several floors up in the Annex. Also, I booked directly through to Hotel website. I have been told that hotels will pay attention to how the reservation was booked and show preference to those who do NOT use a reservation service. Upon checking in, I was guided to my room by a hotel employee and was delighted to find it clean and properly stocked with everything promised. It did take me until the next day to figure out the nightlight in the bathroom, though. The shower was sparkling clean and the water was easily adjusted - hot water plentiful. The water pressure was great and the shower head was terrific. The bed was made up with 4 large pillows (with another in the closet) on 1000 thread-count sheets. There was a safe in the closet (note: customers need to request the key from the front desk if they choose to use it) and plenty of hangers as well as shelves for shoes, bags etc. Breakfast was included in the cost of my stay and consisted of a good sized bowl of fresh fruit, a half of toasted bagel and a small muffin. There were jams and butter for the breads and I was also served a small glass of juice and tea or coffee. In the evening I visited the lounge and was attentively served by the bartender who poured generously. I do have one suggestion to make, which I shared with the staff. I was woken up all three mornings by a room door slamming nearby. I did let the staff know it would be a good idea to try to eliminate this by putting signs on the inside of the room doors that request they be closed quietly between the hours of 11 pm - 9 am. Hopefully they will do it, because I intend to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Funky but not very functional”
Reviews.Author: Shusher
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Washington Square Hotel in early December, 2006. I liked the funky decor and didn't mind the "European"-style (i.e. amazingly tiny) room, and the location can't be beat if you want to explore the Village, MPD and downtown. The price was not bad, either, and the room was very clean. However, if you stay at this hotel I strongly advise that you request a room not facing MacDougal Street. The rooms all have AC/heating units in the windows, rather than built into the walls, which means that it's impossible to close the windows against the street noise, which can be considerable on that busy street. (Due in part to the fact that Mario Battali's popular Babbo restaurant is located about twenty yards away.) I got basically no sleep on the night I was there, due to the constant banging, clanging, honking and shouting. Also, the bed felt a little bit strange -- weirdly convex -- and wasn't very comfortable. Overall, I wouldn't give this one a very strong recommendation, though I can't say for sure whether my experience would be typical.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room with a surprise”
Reviews.Author: winegrower
Reviews.Content: My first floor room had an air conditioner stuffed in the only window and was extremely small. The surprise, a family of COCKROACHES scurrying around. The management did give us a second floor room on night two but it was also very small. Smaller than most Manhattan rooms. The only reason that I did not rate this property as "terrible" is that the location is wonderfful. My recommendation is to see the room first, upgrade to a deluxe, and stay off the lower floor. However, I won't return.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for NYC”
Reviews.Author: Colorobo
Reviews.Content: Great location if you want to see Greenwhich Village. You can walk to Soho, East & West Village, Union Sq., and easy access by subway to all other parts of city. 4th street train station is right down the street. Mario Batali's Babbo is across the street and some great little places to eat on Cornelia St. about 2 blocks away. I especially liked the Cuban place, I think it's called Havana. It on Cornelia. The staff here can be aloof at best and very rude at worst. i stay here a lot as I do work at NYU. Definitely worth splurging for a deluxe room as the regular rooms are VERY SMALL. If you are a toursit I recommend the West Village walking tour offered by Big Onion. They have a website with a schedule of their walking tours. The bar/lounge in the basement behind C3 is hidden, but worth finding.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ange28
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I stayed at the WS hotel in early December & could not fault the hotel. The staff were friendly & helpful, the breakfast of fruit, bagels & tea/coffee was great & the internet access was very handy. You could either use the wireless internet in the lobby or use the internet in your room using cables supplied...of course you do need your own laptop. The hotel is located in Greenwich Village which is a funky / retro area to explore. We stayed in a deluxe double room however I would suggest to get a queen deluxe double room. The double room was smaller then most average European hotel rooms however we still really enjoyed our stay AND we had 4 large suitcases! I booked this hotel via their website (which I found to be the best deal at the time when I booked in June 06) however I was unsure about staying at the hotel because of previous reviews. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in New York & we will definitely be staying at the WS Hotel next time we are in New York.

Reviews.Title: “fairly priced, good location in the Villiage”
Reviews.Author: JoeKino
Reviews.Content: Very friendly place makes all the difference. Clean, older hotel with enough charm to see it through.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: adman1937
Reviews.Content: The Washington Square Hotel is a pleasant departure from the overpriced midtown hotels. Get a deluxe room in the annex and you will be more than happy with your experience. Little amenities like bath robes, night lights, iron, hair dryer and full size umbrella just to name a few. Top that off with a more than adequate free continental breakfast and a quiet Village location and you have a very pleasant stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Claire2Tom
Reviews.Content: We just stayed in this hotel for 5 nights after it was recommended to us by friends who'd stayed there - we weren't disappointed. It's in a fantastic location next to Washington Square gardens and just a few minutes walk from 6th Ave. The reception and 'greeter' in the hotel were exceptionally helpful and friendly. Our room was one of the renovated queen rooms and was not particularly spacious, but was really nicely done out - exactly like the photo we'd seen on their website. Breakfast was table-service of tea/coffee, orange juice, fresh fruit salad, bagels and muffins - not bad at all. We didn't try eating in the hotel restaurant in the evening, but we heard it was good. I fully recommend walking just up the road though to the Apple Restaurant at 17 Waverly Place - the food and ambience were fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel......”
Reviews.Author: gojojo123
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay at this hotel which was in a great location. The room size was small but very clean and quiet. The bathroom was also very clean, updated, and maximized the usage of space. My only negative with the room was with the pillows, which were not very comfortable. However, the bedding and linens were quite comfortable. We also enjoyed dessert in the restaurant which was superb and enjoyed the continental breakfast in the morning. I found the hotel staff to be very accomodating and friendly. I would definately recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: FruityCat
Reviews.Content: I just finished my second stay at the Wash. Square Hotel and it was great, once again. Yes, the rooms are small, but that's NYC. However, the rooms are clean, well-styled, and the beds are comfortable. Secondly, the price and location are hard to beat. I stayed for three nights for $205 a night, before tax, in a lovely and easily accessible part of the city where I felt safe wandering around late at night discovering new places. Thirdly, the staff is wonderful, as they are all helpful and welcoming. I can't comment on the continental breakfast that they serve because I didn't eat there in the morning due to my work schedule. Sure, it's fun to find new places in which to stay in NYC, but I like this hotel and would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nicole83
Reviews.Content: We were slightly worried about staying at this hotel as some of the reviews are not all that great however this hotel is amazing! Okay, the rooms are tiny, the hallways are tiny but the beds are so good and the view from our room was great (Empire State Building). The hotel is really close to everything in New York City and most places are only a $6 cab fare (we walked most places). The doorman was fantastic as was the North Square food (Breakfast was average but the dinners are to die for - we ate there 4 nights out of 7). Would stay here again and recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JetLaggedJet
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel in Greenwich Village, close to subway. Our room on the first night was too hot and quite claustrophobic but there was no problem with getting moved to another room the next day which was much better. It's a great place to stay if you get a room to the front of the building. Decor was really lovely. Complimentary breakfast was also included.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Washington Square”
Reviews.Author: orangegirly
Reviews.Content: We were so lucky with this hotel, the location was fantastic, five minutes from Greenwich Village, two minutes from subway, two minutes from 5th Ave, we absolutely loved the location, if was a wonderful retreat after a hard days shopping/sightseeing to wander through the park and chill out. We stayed in a third floor annexe deluxe room which was more than ample. queen size bed, small bath, powerful shower, more than sufficient towels which is unuusal in hotels, and it was peaceful and after walking uptown where a lot of the other hotels are absolutely amazed at how quiet the hotel was. The desk staff were really friendly and one guy even printed us off some bars to visit and cinema times. For what we wanted ie a room to get some kip and a bit of rest between sightseeing and going out at night it was ideal - Would highly recommend, I have read reviews about the room being small but would disagree, would compare it to a travel inn type medium sized room (UK) maybe small for americans ?, i did notice that there were some rooms without windows or that overlooked another wall which I wouldnt have been that chuffed about so you are probably best asking for a 3rd floor annexe

Reviews.Title: “Little problem in the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: francais8900
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Washington Square Hotel for three days during the hottest days of 2006, but the hotel was cool and comfortable in every way. The front desk clerks were AWESOME (and we dealt with them at many different times of day and night); the maids were very friendly and helpful; the bellmen helped us with our bags, getting a taxi, and finding shops and clubs nearby; the staff in the restaurant at breakfast were very professional and took our order quickly, in spite of the fact that the restaurant was full.
