The bar downstairs was closed for renovations (a fact that almost caused us to go to a different hotel), but the lobby bar is lovely and there were still loads of places to go in the neighborhood. The hotel atmosphere, in the heart of Greenwich Village, is a wonderful break from the noise and heat of the city. Our room was small and didn't have a view (though we've been there before with a view of Washington Square Park), but it was a quiet, spotless room with a really cold air conditioner and a great bed!! The Washington Square will always be our first choice in New York City. And I can't wait 'til the downstairs bar reopens!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice upgraded rooms”
Reviews.Author: sealless
Reviews.Content: First time visit to NYC - great experience at the Washington Square Hotel. Deluxe Queen was plenty "spacious" by NY standards. Everything recently upgraded (except maybe the AC which worked flawlessly). Charming hotel in a great location. Hop on the subway right around the corner if you have to - all you need is within walking distance. Great stay - looking forward to going back. One note -- we tried to book a two night stay online and the deluxe queen room came up as unavailable. Called the hotel directly and it was available. Go figure.

Reviews.Title: “Not great. No more than 2 star”
Reviews.Author: AAOC
Reviews.Content: Hi Stayed here in July. The air conditioning is terrible and the rooms are so small. Do not stay here if you want a romantic weekend in NYC as its really noisy and you won't want to spend any time in your room. We stayed in the Doubletree suites in Time Square last year and they are so much better. More expensive but worth every penny. To be honest, I don't know why this hotel is rated a 3 star on Trip Advisor. At best its a 2 star- its clean and has a good location but rooms are basic and far, far too small. Ask for a deluxe room. We moved to one after the first night and it was just about bearable. Stay in the Doubletreee on Times Square instead - worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “"Deluxe" makes all the difference...”
Reviews.Author: Killer Leprechaun
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here in July, and it was excellent. We had a deluxe, and our 2 sons (20+) were in a superior. BIG difference. Pay the few extra dollars and the better room is wonderful. Service was good, and the location was great. Easy access to the subway, and easy walking to the village, SOHO, etc. Our room was quiet, good bed, and small but very nice bathroom. The hallways are a maze, and the building was old.... but so what? Our experience was excellent. Frequent travelers from Dallas, Texas.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful little place, great location”
Reviews.Author: barl16
Reviews.Content: Just checked out of WSH. What a great place. I had one of the deluxe rooms on the ninth floor. It was very small but the double bed was extremely comfortable and the room was newly rennovated and very well appointed. Being in NYC I wasn't expecting spacious accomodation. My only complaint about the room was that I had a view of a brick wall. But since I was hardly in the room except for sleeping it really wasn't that big of a deal. Location, Location, Location. This hotel is in one of my favourite places in NYC. Located in the heart of Greenich Village on Washtington Square Park, you are close to all the action and many subways. There are great bars and resturants in the area and dinner at the hotel is excellent as well. Continental breakfast is included in the rate and is adequate--fruit, bagel, muffin, OJ and coffee or tea. The breakfast staff in not particularly friendly but all the other staff was. The fitness room is small and woefully outdated but with all the walking one does in NYC that is not such a big deal. Overall I would definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Gem”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel83
Reviews.Content: We recently visited the Washington Square hotel for a three night stay and were very pleased with all that the hotel offered. We loved everything about this hotel. The reservations, front desk, housekeeping and other staff members were wonderful. They were always extremely pleasant, helpful and gracious. The accommodations were lovely - we were in a newly renovated room, and the decor was just beautiful - everything was brand new. The continental breakfast was very nice - juice, coffee, bagels, fresh fruit, etc., and it was brought to our table by the enthusiastic and very efficient staff. The hotel is very convenient to everything the city offers - the subway is right down the street making transportation very easy, and the hotel is right across from Washington Square park, which was a nice perk. We look forward to returning to this hotel in the very near future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Acceptable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Advisor20
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its location despite mixed reviews on Trip Advisor. We made a specific request for an upgraded room when we booked, and also asked for a high floor. Although we did get an ugraded room it was on the second floor so quite noisy. However, if you're staying in a busy part of Manhattan you should expect noise so we always pack earplugs! The room size was above average for NYC and was freshly decorated with a nice bathroom and good shower. The bed was very comfortable.The service from reception staff was acceptable, but the concierge was excellent...extremely friendly and helpful. Breakfast was provided in a pleasant basement cafe and consisted of plenty of coffee and orange juice, a small fruit salad and toasted bagels and muffins. You could also order additional food from the menu which was reasonably priced. Staff were very friendly and cheerful. The location of the hotel was ideal for exploring Greenwich Village, SoHo and the East Village. We would recommend this hotel, but be sure to request a renovated room.

Reviews.Title: “A Treasure”
Reviews.Author: bsnmsn
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, bang in the middle of The Village, adjacent to washington Square park. The staff is accomodating and ultra friendly. The rates are more than fair, considering the location. Breakfast is included, which is a simple continental, but more than enough to get your day going. The subway is close by, as is everything else, it seems. Now, for those with a need for larger rooms, this isn't it. Wireless is free, if you sit in the lobby an that's not the most comfortable place to work, although after three pm, one is welcome to sit in the tearoom, have a pot of fresh brewed tea and work in peace and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice”
Reviews.Author: albertoV05
Reviews.Content: Washington Square Hotel is very well situated in Greenwich Village. There is alot of "ambiance" without the "crowdyness" of Time Square. Around the hotel, there is the beautiful park and many little shops and restaurants. At the hotel, peoples at the front desk are very nice and helpful. You feel in security because there is always a doorman. The rooms are small but that is what we expected. Small is ok because we dont stay in the room when we visit New York. The room are very clean and the bed are comfortable and I think that is the most important. If there is a place they could upgrade, it is for the continental breakfast... it is poor. We got a fruit salad, some bagels and muffin with jam. You can have cheese for your bagel but they don't offer it, we had to ask for it. Maybe we could had something else if we ask for it... Anyway, we really appreciate the place and we will go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because of its location - near my daughter's dorm. The room was not what I booked (I booked a deluxe). It was tiny, no chair, and the bed was small as well. Also, our window looked out on an airshaft which only added to the claustrophobic feeling. The t.v. didn't function properly. The shower curtain was inadequate. Worse than all this, the staff was not helpful and bordering on rude. When we were trying to check in (with an online confirmation) they had to process it somehow and kept telling us to sit down. We would have, but all of the seating in the lobby was occupied. When we were snowed in and needed an extra night's stay we were told they would call us back in 10 minutes (and they didn't). The heat in the room could not be regulated except by turning up the air conditioner. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little bolthole”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all, the rooms are really quite small and don't have a lot of storage space. Every guidebook, hotel website, review etc, mentions this. So don't have unreasonable expectations. Who wants to spend all their time in their room anyway? This is a wonderful little hotel. It has real character. The location, right off Washington Square in the heart of Greenwich Village is perfect. You are less than 2 minutes from the subway. One of the best Italian restaurants in New York is opposite, and the food in the hotel restaurant itself is excellent. The free breakfast is more than adequate for most people - juice, tea or coffee, muffins, bagels and fresh fruit. The beds are extremely comfortable (I stayed in a deluxe room so can't vouch for 'superior' rooms) and the bathroom, though again small, was clean and new, with instant hot water, fluffy white towels and amenities. The staff could not do enough for us. Really friendly front desk lady in the mornings gave us no end of help and advice for tours and sightseeing. We loved it here. We paid around $200 per night which I think is about average for the type of hotel and the location. My last two trips to NYC were spent in more expensive hotels that were not as inviting and were staffed by people who were completely indifferent to us.

Reviews.Title: “Just book the right class of room”
Reviews.Author: karlad
Reviews.Content: This little hotel has a great location, the charm of a European hotel. The rooms are really fine - provided you book a DELUXE and not the "Superior." A chambermaid showed us a Superior, and believe me, you REALLY want to stay in a deluxe - it's worth the extra money. My guess is that all the negative reviews were from people who stayed in a Superior. Nice little bar, nice restaurant in the lowerlevel. The comp breakfast was fine, and the lunch we had there was very good. It's a fine place to hang your hat as you spend (hopefully all) your time exploring NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Tried to steal money from my credit card”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: ok, this hotel was not the greatest thing i have ever seen and was a bit overpriced, but it was comfy enough, and in a great location. i payed by credit card for the first night, as we didnt know how long we were staying but we ended up staying four, and paying each day for the room instead of in a lump sum at the end of the stay (we paid around £80 a night)- i suppose this meant they had plenty of opportunities to make a copy of my card numbers. when i got back to the uk i had an urgent letter from my bank telling me that that money had attempted to be taken from my card on 3 occasions (amounting to about £1000) and giving the exact LOCAL time of the attempts- all of them being around 3 or 4 in the morning. for some reason, barclays had been able to spot that there was some suspicious looking stuff going on with my account, and had not allowed the money to be stolen- but i was the lucky one, and they have probably done this before... there is no doubt at all that it must have been staff at the hotel, as i had used cash for everything else that trip, except paying for the rooms there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lots of character!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After looking at all sorts of hotels in New York from the bargain basement budget to the ludicrously priced luxurious, I settled on the Washington Square Hotel based on positive reviews on this site and a desire to be in Greenwich Village. Since it was my first trip to New York a place I had dreamed of going to having grown up with Flashdance & Fame, I wanted it to be the perfect experience. I enjoyed my stay at the Washington Square Hotel except for the first night which was disappointing as the room was not acceptable. We arrived quite late in the night from London and I think we were given any room that was available. This particular deluxe room (which we paid extra for as it was supposed to be one of their newer rooms) was small and filthy especially the bathroom or the bath tub. As it was so late there was nothing they could do but we were promised another room the following day, which they delivered with a smile and no bad attitude. The room was one of the biggest in the hotel and located in the annexe area where they were doing a lot of rennovation. The room was perfect as it was a really good size (big), no noise and the bathroom was spotless. Evey morning we were greeted by friendly staff in the restaurant and started the day with a very filling complimentary breakfast of bagels, muffins, fresh fruit and juice/hot drink. The Washington Square is not the Ritz but it has lots of character, friendly staff (even the work men renovating the rooms)and was in the best part of New York, Greenwich Village with it's cool bohemian vibe, shops, bars, restaurants and Soho and Tribeca only a stones throw away. Washington Square Park is directly opposite the hotel and for 'Sex and the City' fans the Patricia Field shop is a couple of blocks away from the hotel (which I did not get to visit). I would probably stay there again mainly for the location but I would recommend booking a deluxe room, newly rennovated (3rd Floor Annexe) preferably with a view of Waverly Place although view is unimportant with so much to do and see in New York!!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: annensteve
Reviews.Content: This is probably one of the worst hotel rooms that we have ever stayed in. The website gives a great impression of all rooms, even those that have not yet been refurbished - one of which we stayed in. The room was on the ground floor, with no double glazing - so noisy it was difficult to sleep. It was also over the kitchen so we had roller doors being opened and closed during the night! The bathroom was tired to say the least and the carpet tiles were lifting from the floor. Staff attitude tended to be 'so what? be grateful for what you have' We had asked for non smoking rooms and our friends had to be moved as they were given a very smelly smoking room - never mind the new room (that was much smaller) overlooked a brick wall! Having said that the art deco lobby and public areas were lovely, the public lounge and restarant were popular with locals and the location is great for Greenwhich Village and the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Fears Laid to Rest”
Reviews.Author: 2muchstuff
Reviews.Content: After reading recent reviews of this hotel, I was terrified that the group of six women who had entrusted me with making room reservations would lynch me after our first night. However, instead of the tiny, noisy inadequate rooms I had read about we had very nice, quiet, and recently redecorated rooms. The bathrooms had instant hot water and nice towels. Our $190 per night room rate for the busiest weekend of the year even included breakfast each day. We were one block from the subway station, and the neighborhood was fun. One of the best restaurants in Manhattan is right across the street. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Washington Square Hotel--it's a great place for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: VRL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had only one request when we booked a room here. We wanted a quiet room. We were given a room on the ground floor, which I was reluctant to accept, but the staff member insisted it would be quiet. I did not sleep at all throughout the night. The walls were paper-thin and there was a very, very loud party going on all night. Once the party settled down at around sunrise, I was then kept up by morning street noises. I packed up and left at 6:30 am because I could not take it any longer. It was miserable. Also, the quality of the room was not much better than "flophouse." The mattress had a plastic feel, the carpet was ancient and institutional looking, the towels felt like cardboard, and there was not one pleasant or comfortable touch in the whole room.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location - stop moaning people!”
Reviews.Author: Sara28London
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the washington Square hotel for 7 nights. I was never disturbed by noise and the room was always clean. The rooms here are small but every travel guide and website tells you to expect this - you don't go to NY to sit in your room. The bathroom too is adequate. I personally prefer the fact that this hotel does not have doormen, bell hops etc as if i wanted all of that I would stay at a luxury hotel that costs a lot more and this hotel never claims to be that. It isn't 'dated' it is a period building. The location is simply perfect - two subways covering 4 different lines just a block away and easy walking distance to Soho, east Village etc - all in all a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel, horrible staff”
Reviews.Author: abol
Reviews.Content: This hotel has to be one of my worst hotel experiences to date. I travel frequently but have never seen something quite like this "hotel" as they call it. I would call it more of a hostel. There is no doorman, no bellman, no friendly faces on the staff. The place looks extremely dated, despite the front desk manager telling me that the rooms were recently renovated. Putting a new duvet on the bed is not renovating. The elevator opens into a stairwell, there is an ancient metal door between hallways which I was told was for fire safety, although the door was about 80 years old. The walls are paper thin and I didn't sleep at all due to the noise from the street and the halls. There are window A/C units. I haven't seen a window a/c unit in a hotel ever before. There was no desk, the TV was hanging from the ceiling and the carpet was stained. The first room I was in had a questionable stain on one of the beds, when I asked to be moved, the mgr insisted that there was no stain when he checked the room earlier that day. I asked him if he'd like to see it for himself and he declined. The room they moved me to had hair in the bed when I pulled back the covers. Needless to say, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. The manager informed me that for the price, the accomodations are quite reasonable. I don't care about price, I expect service and quality. There are many places to stay in NY that are in great locations and charming, unfortunately this hotel is not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Amsterdamer
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I arrived to find out that our request to stay in a room several floors up was ignored. We were given a room on the ground floor for that evening and promised our reservation the next morning. We could not sleep due to the noise on the street. We also found out the next morning that it was on the direct route to the restaurant and awoke to the sounds of high heels hitting floor boards and people talking loudly outside our door. We arrived at the desk the next morning with our copious amounts of baggage to change rooms and were given blank stares by the day staff member. The only other room was a room on a smoking floor that smelt of smoke. We accepted it in the hope that we would at least get some sleep and were promised an air refresher machine which never arrived despite repeated requests. By far the worse aspect of our stay was the faulty ALARM SYSTEM!!! It went off accidentally 3 times during 4 days two being at 4am and 6am. We were informed by staff that it happens regularly and was offered no form of compensation. While standing around in the foyer with the other guests, cold and in my pyjamas, I firmly decided that (a) I would not stay here again; and (b) would write this review to warn others. It is in a great location though so look for somewhere else in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “relatively cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Whenever I visit NYC I stay in this beautifully located hotel. The rooms are simple, but efficient. (But bring candles to give the room ambiente!) The bathrooms are quite spacy and have a window. If you're staying in the double bedroom with q-size bed ask for the higher floors, as you will have a lovely view of the Village even from your bathroom! The staff is friendly and helpful. Breakfast (included) is very sober, but there are many nice breakfast places and restaurants in the area. The location is superb: within walking distance from SoHo, East Village, West Village, Union Square, Meat Packing District, Chelsea etc. Subwaystations around the corner. Very good price value!

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Safe”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room we had in this hotel was clean but simple. The rooms are not large but are adequate. Bathroom was very clean, fresh towels each day, maid service was excellent. Great location, close to many restaurants and sights. Continental breakfast included with room at $199/night. Looking forward to staying again next time we are in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, simple, small rooms! good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: YOU CANT BEAT THE AREA OR LOCATION! I love to save money on cheap hotels in the city. I say save your money, stay here, and spend a few extra days in NYC! Dont expect much from your room and you will love it. Great rates, nice lobby, super small rooms, free breakfast, and spotty internet access!

Reviews.Title: “Very nicely done!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in June of 2005. Cost was roughly $195/night. First things first, the rooms are not large. Our room was about 10 feet by 10 feet, with a bathroom off to one side. Enough room for a double bed, two nightstands, small desk, tv. For all the other reviewers who complained of the tiny hallways and rooms, it's Manhattan...grow up and deal with it. I've yet to find a cheaper alternative in Manhattan, let alone in Greenwich Village that provides what this hotel does. Free breakfast consists of coffee/tea, bread, muffins and fruit. Breakfast menu is also available. Location, location, location. It's about a block and half to the West 4th St Subway station, and 5th avenue is about two blocks away. Took the subway nearly everywhere, only needed a taxi a couple of times. We'll make the Washington Square Hotel a regular spot when we're in New York. $195/night may sound kind of pricey, but you have to look at the overall bang for the buck. The convienice of location, price, food, etc make the Washington Square Hotel a great spot.

Reviews.Title: “Room 125 Hell On Earth”
Reviews.Author: valmont
Reviews.Content: Stay away! The only good thing about this dump is the position – close to the subway and walking distance to Soho, Chinatown, Little Italy and The Village. Otherwise, pay a little extra and stay somewhere else. We’d prepaid the room through a travel agent in Australia and found a poky space barely big enough for the bed, just off the lobby and on a direct route from the lobby through to the restaurant – with the marble corridor, we were kept awake through the night with people walking past. The noise from the restaurant below (the kitchen staff were playing the radio loudly as they packed up for the night) made it even worse, as did the exhaust fans from the kitchen in the airshaft right outside our window, which had to be kept open (even in the cold of winter when we were there) cause the heating couldn’t be shut off and we could have grown orchids in the heat. Reception staff had that fixed smile of people who’d heard too many complaints and couldn’t care less anyway. We were told we could upgrade for another $US25 (despite having prepaid $US100 a night above their declared walk-in rate). It’s the only hotel I’ve ever encountered where I had to wear earplugs to get to sleep! This place is worse than sleeping in the street. Come to think of it, the rats scurrying through the garbage in the street outside seemed a lot happier than the Washington Square’s clientele.

Reviews.Title: “super little haven”
Reviews.Author: U3
Reviews.Content: delighted to have found this little haven in busy NYC! breakfast was indeed very convenient and you could chose to pay extra for a varied menu. The room (Quad) was small but very clean and comfortable, the staff were helpful and the guests varied from savvy european to NYU visiting dons!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel with lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for our last night in New York last week. On arrival we were greeted with very pleasant staff who made us feel like real people not just a room number. However, they could only offer us a room with a shared bathroom but at the time no one else was in the other room and they said they would only let it out to a female. Later we were informed that a female had checked in. (I suspect she had been booked in all the time). Anyway the room was rather disappointing as it was cramped and pretty run down and shabby. Also it was only on the second floor so was noisy from the traffic down below. The bathroom itself had no heating and was freezing with a cold tiled floor, however, that was not the case with our room which was boiling with a noisy radiator! However, the bed and pillows were very nice and comfortable with soft cotton linen. And the location was great with plenty of places to eat and drink in and around the area. I paid £100 for this room which I think was definitely too much for the room but I guess it's about location location location. Also I booked it late so that could also be why. I think if we were staying there longer we would have asked for a better room but as it was only for one night it was OK and you also get a continental breakfast included which was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “great location, very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Washington Square Hotel for one night last weekend with my teenage daughter. The staff of the hotel were exceptionally nice, the room was nicely decorated in a modern style, although it was a bit small. It was very clean. The breakfast, included in the price of the room, was nice and quick. You sit down, they fill your glasses with orange juice, they plunk down a fresh fruit salad in front of you, then plunk down a basket of toasted bagels and muffins. If you're in a hurry and don't want something fancier, it's fine. If you want eggs and bacon you may have to go elsewhere. Yes, the hotel architecture is interesting, at best. Yes, there's crazy hallways and staircases and deadends. But what can the hotel do about that, short of tearing down and rebuilding? It's an old, historic building. Get over it. At least the rooms and bathrooms are modernized. Unfortunately, the heating system is not. Our room was at least 120 degrees F. It was more comfortable after I completely turned off the radiators. The only other minus was that the pillows were terribly hard. Otherwise, it was a fun, if a bit funky, place to stay right in a very nice, fun area.
